analyzed: ral gris gtsab cing gsheg pa /
translated: cut and slashed with swords,

original: gsal shing bsgrengs pa la bskyon pa /
analyzed: gsal shing bsgrengs pa la bskyon pa /
translated: impaled on stakes,

original: lus thams cad kun nas glegs te me 'bar ba'i nang du dor ba'am /
analyzed: lus thams cad kun nas glegs te me 'bar ba'i nang du dor ba'am /
translated: their entire bodies wrapped up and thrown into a blazing fire,

original: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa mi bde ba thams cad kyis mi bde bar bya ba gtse ba sna tshogs thams cad du bsgre ba zhig byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mthong bar gyur na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa mi bde ba thams cad kyis mi bde bar bya ba gtse ba sna tshogs thams cad du bsgre ba zhig byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mthong bar gyur na /
translated: When a bodhisattva great being sees all the various kinds of suffering, all the various kinds of unhappiness, and all the various kinds of harm,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de gsad par bya bde'i don du lus yongs su gtong ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de gsad par bya bde'i don du lus yongs su gtong ste /
translated: then for the sake of those who are to be killed, that bodhisattva great being gives up his body.

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' mi pham pa dang / rgyal po khyad par du 'gro bas ji ltar byas pa dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan rnams kyang sems can gsad pa bslu ba'i don du lus yongs su gtong zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' mi pham pa dang / rgyal po khyad par du 'gro bas ji ltar byas pa dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan rnams kyang sems can gsad pa bslu ba'i don du lus yongs su gtong zhing /
translated: Just as the bodhisattvas Ajita and King Viśeṣagāmin did, and just as other bodhisattva great beings do, they give up their bodies in order to deceive those who are to kill sentient beings,

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba thams cad nyams su len pa de bzhin du rab tu @260a *//
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba thams cad nyams su len pa de bzhin du rab tu @260a *//
translated: and they undergo all kinds of painful feelings.🔽In the same way, they give up their bodies.

original: gtong ba byed cing tshig 'di skad du smra'o //
analyzed: gtong ba byed cing tshig 'di skad du smra'o //
translated: They say these words:

original: khyed kyi mi bde ba 'di dag bdag la gyis shig /
analyzed: khyed kyi mi bde ba 'di dag bdag la gyis shig /
translated: ‘Make all this unhappiness of yours mine!

original: lus 'di yongs su gtong gi /
analyzed: lus 'di yongs su gtong gi /
translated: I give up this body.

original: nga'i srog gcad par gyis shig /
analyzed: nga'i srog gcad par gyis shig /
translated: Kill me!

original: nga la ni /
analyzed: nga la ni /
translated: I have no regard for

original: ci byas so cog kyang mi nyan pa med kyi /
analyzed: ci byas so cog kyang mi nyan pa med kyi /
translated: anything at all.

original: khyed kyis mi 'di la ci bya bar 'dod pa de las grangs med pa'i 'gyur du sdug bsngal gyi rnam pas gtse ba thams cad kyis mi bde ba sna tshogs su gyis shig /
analyzed: khyed kyis mi 'di la ci bya bar 'dod pa de las grangs med pa'i 'gyur du sdug bsngal gyi rnam pas gtse ba thams cad kyis mi bde ba sna tshogs su gyis shig /
translated: Whatever you want to do to this man, do it to me a hundred times over.

original: ces te / 'di ltar bdag gis gsad par bkri ba mthong yang bdag gi lus dang / srog gis mi blu ba ni /
analyzed: ces te / 'di ltar bdag gis gsad par bkri ba mthong yang bdag gi lus dang / srog gis mi blu ba ni /
translated: Even though I see that I am being led to execution, I will not betray my body and life.

original: bdag la tshul dang mi 'dra'o //
analyzed: bdag la tshul dang mi 'dra'o //
translated: That would be contrary to my character.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽bdag gis ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / bdag gis ni /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can thams cad la dmigs te 'gro ba thams cad bsrung ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la dmigs te 'gro ba thams cad bsrung ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed do //
translated: I have taken all sentient beings as my focus and, in order to protect all beings, I have given rise to the mind set on awakening.

original: snyam nas bdag gi lus dang srog yongs su btang ste gsad par bya ba de blus nas dge ba'i rtsa ba de 'di ltar yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: snyam nas bdag gi lus dang srog yongs su btang ste gsad par bya ba de blus nas dge ba'i rtsa ba de 'di ltar yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: Thinking this, I will give up my body and life and betray the one who is to be executed. I will dedicate the roots of virtue in the following way:

original: sems can thams cad gzhan gyis gtse ba'i sdug bsngal nye bar byung bas lus dang srog shin tu mi 'phrog par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad gzhan gyis gtse ba'i sdug bsngal nye bar byung bas lus dang srog shin tu mi 'phrog par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings not be deprived of their bodies and lives by the sufferings of being harmed by others.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad las thams cad mkhyen pa'i byang chub stobs bcur lung bstan pa'i gnas rab tu thob par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad las thams cad mkhyen pa'i byang chub stobs bcur lung bstan pa'i gnas rab tu thob par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings attain the state of being prophesied by all the Buddhas as having the ten powers of omniscience.

original: sems can thams cad ngan song thams cad kyi lam las yongs su 'das te 'jigs pa thams cad las rab tu thar par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ngan song thams cad kyi lam las yongs su 'das te 'jigs pa thams cad las rab tu thar par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings go beyond all the paths of the lower realms and be completely liberated from all fears.

original: sems can thams cad @260b 'chi ba med pa'i ye shes kyi dbyings su zhugs pas 'tsho ba thams cad kyi skabs rab tu rnyed par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad @260b 'chi ba med pa'i ye shes kyi dbyings su zhugs pas 'tsho ba thams cad kyi skabs rab tu rnyed par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings find the opportunity to live by entering the realm of deathless wisdom.

original: sems can thams cad dge ba'i bshes gnyen de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su bzung bas dgras 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral bar gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad dge ba'i bshes gnyen de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su bzung bas dgras 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral bar gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings be free from all the fears of enemies by being cared for by the spiritual friend, the Tathagata.

original: sems can thams cad kha na ma thob med pa'i las dge ba thams cad spyod pas ral gris gtsab pa lta bu'i mi bde ba thams cad las 'das par gyur cig /🔽sems can thams cad byang chub kyi shing dam pa'i drung du phyin cing 'jigs pa med par bdud kyi sde thams cad rnam par 'thor bas bag tsha ba dang / 'jigs shing skrag pa thams cad dang bral bar gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kha na ma thob med pa'i las dge ba thams cad spyod pas ral gris gtsab pa lta bu'i mi bde ba thams cad las 'das par gyur cig / sems can thams cad byang chub kyi shing dam pa'i drung du phyin cing 'jigs pa med par bdud kyi sde thams cad rnam par 'thor bas bag tsha ba dang / 'jigs shing skrag pa thams cad dang bral bar gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings be free from all the discomforts of being pricked by thorns and so on, by engaging in all virtuous actions without any negative actions.🔽May all sentient beings come into the presence of the sublime tree of enlightenment and, being fearless, may they be free from all anxiety and fear by scattering the hordes of demons.

original: sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i chos kyi 'jigs pa med pas rnam par dag cing khyu mchog dang / sengge'i nga ro 'byin pas 'khor gyi 'jigs pa dang bag tsha ba thams cad dang bral bar gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i chos kyi 'jigs pa med pas rnam par dag cing khyu mchog dang / sengge'i nga ro 'byin pas 'khor gyi 'jigs pa dang bag tsha ba thams cad dang bral bar gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings be free from all the fears of the assembly by being endowed with the pure, unsurpassed, fearless Dharma and by proclaiming the lion’s roar of the supreme leader.

original: sems can thams cad kha na ma tho ba med pa'i las la yang dag par spyod cing 'gro ba thams cad kyi nang na bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i sengger gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kha na ma tho ba med pa'i las la yang dag par spyod cing 'gro ba thams cad kyi nang na bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i sengger gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings engage in irreproachable actions and become lions with unobstructed wisdom in the midst of all beings.

original: sems can thams cad skye bo kun yongs su skyong ba'i sems dang ldan zhing 'gro ba kun tu 'jigs pa med pa'i khang par zhugs par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad skye bo kun yongs su skyong ba'i sems dang ldan zhing 'gro ba kun tu 'jigs pa med pa'i khang par zhugs par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have a mind that protects all beings and enter the house of fearlessness in all worlds.

original: ces de ltar gsad par gyur ba dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rang gi lus dang srog btang ste blus @261a *//
analyzed: ces de ltar gsad par gyur ba dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rang gi lus dang srog btang ste blus @261a *//
translated: Thus, when sentient beings are about to be killed, bodhisattva great beings should ransom them with their own bodies and lives.

original: nas dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyi 'khor ba'i btson ra'i sdug bsngal kun spangs pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bde ba mi spang pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: nas dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyi 'khor ba'i btson ra'i sdug bsngal kun spangs pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bde ba mi spang pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: Having ransomed them, they should dedicate the roots of virtue to the abandonment of all the suffering of the prison of cyclic existence for all sentient beings and to the non-abandonment of the bliss of all buddhas.

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la mgo las gtsug phud dang thor pag tu bcas pa bslangs na /🔽rgyal po gtsug na rin po che dang / byang chub sems dpa' yan lag dam pa shin tu 'phags pa dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag gis ji ltar byin pa de bzhin du des slong ba de dag mthong nas gtong bar mos pa'i tshig dge bas thor pag dang gtsug phud du bcos te khyer cig /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la mgo las gtsug phud dang thor pag tu bcas pa bslangs na / rgyal po gtsug na rin po che dang / byang chub sems dpa' yan lag dam pa shin tu 'phags pa dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag gis ji ltar byin pa de bzhin du des slong ba de dag mthong nas gtong bar mos pa'i tshig dge bas thor pag dang gtsug phud du bcos te khyer cig /
translated: In the same way, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva is asked for the hair of his head and the topknot of his crown,

original: ces stob cing /
analyzed: ces stob cing /
translated: just as King Cūḍāmaṇi, the bodhisattva Uttamāṅga, and other bodhisattvas gave [their hair], in the same way, when he sees those who ask, he should imagine that he is giving them, and with virtuous words he should offer them his hair and topknot, saying, ‘Please take them.’

original: kye tshur sheg /
analyzed: kye tshur sheg /
translated: ‘Come here!

original: bdag gi mgo las gtsug phud dang / thor pag tu bcas pa longs shig /
analyzed: bdag gi mgo las gtsug phud dang / thor pag tu bcas pa longs shig /
translated: Take the hair of my head and the topknot of my crown.’

original: ces nas byang chub sems dpa' 'dzam bu'i gling na btsun pa mi'i dam pa des yid rtse gcig tu byas te yid ma 'khrugs pa dang / yid ma 'dres pa dang / las gzhan la mi sems pa'i yid dang / 'jig rten las 'phags pa'i yid dang /
analyzed: ces nas byang chub sems dpa' 'dzam bu'i gling na btsun pa mi'i dam pa des yid rtse gcig tu byas te yid ma 'khrugs pa dang / yid ma 'dres pa dang / las gzhan la mi sems pa'i yid dang / 'jig rten las 'phags pa'i yid dang /
translated: Then, the bodhisattva, the most venerable and sublime person in the world, with a one-pointed mind, an undisturbed mind, an unconfused mind, a mind not thinking of other actions, a mind that transcends the world,

original: rab tu zhi ba'i yid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi yid dang / dag pa'i yid dang / drang ba'i yid dang / rig pa la brtson pa'i yid kyis gtsug phud dang / thor pag tu bcas pa de slong ba la gtong ba'i tshe gtsug phud dang /
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba'i yid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi yid dang / dag pa'i yid dang / drang ba'i yid dang / rig pa la brtson pa'i yid kyis gtsug phud dang / thor pag tu bcas pa de slong ba la gtong ba'i tshe gtsug phud dang /
translated: a mind of complete peace, a mind of omniscience, a pure mind, an honest mind, and a mind diligent in knowledge, when giving away his topknot and braids,

original: thor pag tu bcas @261b par tshon gyis phog ste mgo las phab nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la bcugs te rim gro dang bcas pa'i lus kyis sor mo bcu'i thal mo sbyar nas 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub kyi spyod pa rjes su dran pa'i sems bskyed pa dang /
analyzed: thor pag tu bcas @261b par tshon gyis phog ste mgo las phab nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la bcugs te rim gro dang bcas pa'i lus kyis sor mo bcu'i thal mo sbyar nas 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub kyi spyod pa rjes su dran pa'i sems bskyed pa dang /
translated: He then removed his turban, which was dyed with various colors, and placed it on the ground. He then knelt on his right knee and, with his body respectfully bent, he joined his ten fingers in homage. He then remembered the bodhisattva conduct of all the buddhas of the past, present, and future.

original: dga' bas rnam par spel ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / chos kyis yongs su rgyas pa'i yid kyi dbang dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas dengs par mi 'gyur ba'i yid kyi dbang po dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba skye ba'i mtshan nyid dang tha dad par khong du chud pa dang /
analyzed: dga' bas rnam par spel ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / chos kyis yongs su rgyas pa'i yid kyi dbang dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas dengs par mi 'gyur ba'i yid kyi dbang po dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba skye ba'i mtshan nyid dang tha dad par khong du chud pa dang /
translated: He had the superior intention that was increased by joy, the power of mind that was expanded by the Dharma, the faculty of mind that was not diminished by painful feelings, and the understanding that the characteristics of the arising of painful feelings were different.

original: tshor ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa de dag thams cad mi rtag go /
analyzed: tshor ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa de dag thams cad mi rtag go /
translated: He understood that all those feelings, one after another, were impermanent.

original: zhes bya bar rab tu shes pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba thams cad dang rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu gyur pa'i gtong ba'i sems dang / sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa las phyir mi ldog pa dang /
analyzed: zhes bya bar rab tu shes pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba thams cad dang rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu gyur pa'i gtong ba'i sems dang / sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa las phyir mi ldog pa dang /
translated: they never turn back from arousing the mind of enlightenment in all sentient beings;

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa lhag pa'i bsam pa'i rnam pas thob pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa lhag pa'i bsam pa'i rnam pas thob pa /
translated: they have attained the bodhisattva conduct through the power of superior intention;🔽they do not depend on others, and they abide in the way taught by the spiritual friend.

original: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bstan pa'i tshul la gnas te gtsug phud dang / thor pag tu bcas pa mgo las phog ste yongs su gtong pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /🔽sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i gtsug gi mchod rten du gyur te gtsug gtor bltar mi snang bar gyur cig /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bstan pa'i tshul la gnas te gtsug phud dang / thor pag tu bcas pa mgo las phog ste yongs su gtong pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste / sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i gtsug gi mchod rten du gyur te gtsug gtor bltar mi snang bar gyur cig /
translated: When they give away their hair and topknot, which are on their heads, they dedicate the goodness in this way:

original: sems can @262a *//
analyzed: sems can @262a *//
translated: ‘May all sentient beings become the crown protuberance of the bodhisattvas, and may their topknots be invisible.’

original: thams cad skra shin tu phra ba dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad rnam par bsal cing skra rdo rje nag po'i dam pa lta bur gyur cig /
analyzed: thams cad skra shin tu phra ba dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad rnam par bsal cing skra rdo rje nag po'i dam pa lta bur gyur cig /
translated: May all beings have hair that is very fine, and may they have hair that is like the best of black diamonds, having cleared away all afflictions.

original: sems can thams cad skra stug cing skra mtshams legs pa dang / skra snum par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad skra stug cing skra mtshams legs pa dang / skra snum par gyur cig /
translated: May all beings have thick hair, with a good hairline, and glossy hair.

original: sems can thams cad mgo legs pa las shin tu legs par skyes pa'i skra rab tu 'jam pa dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad mgo legs pa las shin tu legs par skyes pa'i skra rab tu 'jam pa dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all beings have hair that is very soft, born from a good head.

original: sems can thams cad skra dga' ba 'khyil ba ltar g-yas phyogs su 'khyil cing dpal gyi be'u dang / bkra shis kyi skra dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad skra dga' ba 'khyil ba ltar g-yas phyogs su 'khyil cing dpal gyi be'u dang / bkra shis kyi skra dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all beings have hair that curls to the right, like a delightful curl, and have hair that is a swastika, a sign of good fortune.

original: sems can thams cad nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las rnam par 'das shin sangs rgyas kyi mtshan dang ldan pa'i skra thob par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las rnam par 'das shin sangs rgyas kyi mtshan dang ldan pa'i skra thob par gyur cig /
translated: May all beings have hair that is the sign of a buddha, having gone beyond afflictions and the secondary afflictions.

original: sems can thams cad phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten du 'gro ba thams cad rgyas par rang gi skra las 'od zer rab tu 'gyed par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten du 'gro ba thams cad rgyas par rang gi skra las 'od zer rab tu 'gyed par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings radiate light from their hair, filling the worlds in the ten directions.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi dbu shin tu rnam par dag pa ltar skra shin tu mdzes par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi dbu shin tu rnam par dag pa ltar skra shin tu mdzes par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have beautiful hair like the completely pure head of a buddha.

original: sems can thams cad sems ma nyams shing sangs rgyas kyi dbu skra dang / dbu lta bur mdzes pa dang ldan pas spyi bo la gzhag pa'i mchod rten du 'os pa'i skra dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sems ma nyams shing sangs rgyas kyi dbu skra dang / dbu lta bur mdzes pa dang ldan pas spyi bo la gzhag pa'i mchod rten du 'os pa'i skra dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have hair worthy of being placed on the crown of the head and worshipped like a stupa, with hair as beautiful as the head of a buddha, and with a mind that is not corrupted.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi dbu ltar chags pa med pa'i skra mdzes par skyes pas mun pa dang rdul mi chags pa dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi dbu ltar chags pa med pa'i skra mdzes par skyes pas mun pa dang rdul mi chags pa dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have hair that is as beautiful as the head of a buddha, free from attachment, and unstained by dust and dirt.

original: ces de @262b ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gtsug phud dang thor pag tu bcas pa yongs su btang bas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyi sa lta bur shin tu zhi ba'i sems yongs su rdzogs
analyzed: ces de @262b ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gtsug phud dang thor pag tu bcas pa yongs su btang bas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyi sa lta bur shin tu zhi ba'i sems yongs su rdzogs
translated: Thus, the roots of virtue that the bodhisattva mahāsattva has gathered by giving away his topknot and hair are dedicated so that all sentient beings may perfect the mind that is as stable as the earth

original: par bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs bcu'i mthas gtugs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: par bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs bcu'i mthas gtugs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: and so that they may reach the end of the ten powers of omniscience.

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po slong ba rnams la ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' dga' ba byed pa dang / rgyal po zla 'od dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' tshad med pa gzhan dag gis gtong ba'i mig yongs su sbyangs pa'i sems dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po slong ba rnams la ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' dga' ba byed pa dang / rgyal po zla 'od dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' tshad med pa gzhan dag gis gtong ba'i mig yongs su sbyangs pa'i sems dang /
translated: “Moreover, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, in order to please the beggars, as the bodhisattva Nanda, King Candraprabha, and other innumerable bodhisattvas did, should train in the mind of giving away his eyes.

original: ye shes kyi mig yongs su sbyangs pa'i blo dang / chos kyi snang ba rab tu thob pa'i yid kyi gnas dang / bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas mngon du gyur pa'i yid kyi rnam pa dang / mngon par shes pa thams cad kyi mthar thug pa'i yongs su bsngo ba dang /
analyzed: ye shes kyi mig yongs su sbyangs pa'i blo dang / chos kyi snang ba rab tu thob pa'i yid kyi gnas dang / bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas mngon du gyur pa'i yid kyi rnam pa dang / mngon par shes pa thams cad kyi mthar thug pa'i yongs su bsngo ba dang /
translated: the mind that is purified by the eye of wisdom, the mental state that has attained the light of the Dharma, the mental aspect that has actualized the unsurpassed Buddha, and the dedication that is the culmination of all higher perceptions.

original: ye shes kyi skye mched la yang dag par btang ba'i sems dang / dus gsum gyi byang chub sems dpa' dang mnyam par byas pa'i sbyin pa dang / gtong ba'i sems dang / zhe sdang ba med pa'i mig gis dad pa mi ldog pa'i dbang dang /
analyzed: ye shes kyi skye mched la yang dag par btang ba'i sems dang / dus gsum gyi byang chub sems dpa' dang mnyam par byas pa'i sbyin pa dang / gtong ba'i sems dang / zhe sdang ba med pa'i mig gis dad pa mi ldog pa'i dbang dang /
translated: the mind that is dedicated to the domain of wisdom, the generosity that is equal to the bodhisattvas of the three times, the mind of giving, the power of unwavering faith with eyes free of hostility,

original: slong ba rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i sems dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyan la gzhol bas byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po dang / byams pa dang / snying rje @263a *//
analyzed: slong ba rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i sems dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyan la gzhol bas byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po dang / byams pa dang / snying rje @263a *//
translated: the mind that benefits those who ask, the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattvas that is focused on the eye of the buddhas, and love and compassion

original: yongs su sgom pa dang / dbang po drug shin tu bsdams pas slong ba rnams la mig byin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: yongs su sgom pa dang / dbang po drug shin tu bsdams pas slong ba rnams la mig byin pa de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way that he gives his eyes to beggars by means of the six sense faculties,

original: de yang mig yongs su gtong zhing chos de lta bu la zhugs pa'i sems kyis slong ba dang / 'dod pa dag la sbyin pa byed cing mchod sbyin gyi don la 'jug pa dang / chos kyi mthu shin tu bskyed pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyi dga' bar lta ba dang /
analyzed: de yang mig yongs su gtong zhing chos de lta bu la zhugs pa'i sems kyis slong ba dang / 'dod pa dag la sbyin pa byed cing mchod sbyin gyi don la 'jug pa dang / chos kyi mthu shin tu bskyed pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyi dga' bar lta ba dang /
translated: he gives his eyes and, with a mind engaged in such a practice, he gives to beggars and to those who desire them. He engages in the meaning of sacrifice by means of giving. He generates the power of the Dharma. He views the delight of the entire world.

original: bag med pa'i sred pa rnam par zlog par byed pa dang / 'jig rten gyi dga' ba dang / 'dod pa sna tshogs mthong bas rang gi dga' ba khong du chud par byed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dga' ba myong bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: bag med pa'i sred pa rnam par zlog par byed pa dang / 'jig rten gyi dga' ba dang / 'dod pa sna tshogs mthong bas rang gi dga' ba khong du chud par byed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dga' ba myong bar byed pa dang /
translated: He turns away from craving carelessness. He understands his own delight by means of seeing the various worldly delights and desires. He experiences the delight of the bodhisattvas.

original: ci bslangs pa'i dngos pos kha mi stong bar byed pa dang / mi gnyis pa'i sbyin pa rjes su srung ba dang / rlom sems med pas shin tu sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba dang / slong ba rnams kyis dngos po ci bslangs pa sbyin par byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: ci bslangs pa'i dngos pos kha mi stong bar byed pa dang / mi gnyis pa'i sbyin pa rjes su srung ba dang / rlom sems med pas shin tu sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba dang / slong ba rnams kyis dngos po ci bslangs pa sbyin par byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: When they give to beggars whatever they have requested, they dedicate the wholesome roots in the following way:

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad 'gro ba thams cad kyi mig tu gyur te mig gi dam par gyur cig /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad 'gro ba thams cad kyi mig tu gyur te mig gi dam par gyur cig /
translated: ‘Through these wholesome roots, may all sentient beings become eyes for all worlds, and may they become the best of eyes.

original: sems can thams cad ye shes kyi mdzod shin tu yangs pas nyams pa med pa'i mig tu gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ye shes kyi mdzod shin tu yangs pas nyams pa med pa'i mig tu gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings become eyes that are never impaired by the vast treasury of wisdom.

original: sems can thams cad snang ba mi 'phrog pa dang ldan zhing sha'i mig rnam par dag pa yongs su grub par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad snang ba mi 'phrog pa dang ldan zhing sha'i mig rnam par dag pa yongs su grub par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have eyes of flesh that are pure and perfect, and that are never obscured.

original: sems can thams cad 'chi 'pho @263b dang skye ba shes shing lha'i mig rnam par dag par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'chi 'pho @263b dang skye ba shes shing lha'i mig rnam par dag par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have the pure divine eye, knowing death and rebirth.

original: sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi rjes su 'dong zhing chos kyi mig rab tu thob par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi rjes su 'dong zhing chos kyi mig rab tu thob par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings attain the eye of Dharma, following the wisdom of the tathagatas.

original: sems can thams cad gtong ba thams cad rnam par ston pas shes rab kyi mig thob par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad gtong ba thams cad rnam par ston pas shes rab kyi mig thob par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings attain the eye of wisdom, demonstrating all forms of generosity.

original: sems can thams cad chos thams cad mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi spyan dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad chos thams cad mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi spyan dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings possess the eye of the buddhas, manifestly awakening to all phenomena.

original: sems can thams cad chags pa med pa'i mig gi mthar thug ste kun tu lta ba'i mig dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad chags pa med pa'i mig gi mthar thug ste kun tu lta ba'i mig dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings possess the eye of all-seeing, the ultimate eye of nonattachment.

original: sems can thams cad sems can gyi khams yongs su shes shing rab rim med pa'i mig dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sems can gyi khams yongs su shes shing rab rim med pa'i mig dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings possess the eye of the absence of levels, knowing the realm of sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad stobs bcu mnga' ba'i de bzhin gshegs par phyin pas bsgribs pa'i mig dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad stobs bcu mnga' ba'i de bzhin gshegs par phyin pas bsgribs pa'i mig dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings possess the eye of unobstruction, having attained the state of a tathagata endowed with the ten powers.

original: ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mig yongs su gtong ba na thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshad kyi mig gi chos sems can thams cad yongs su bsngo ba la nye bar 'god do //🔽bam po sum cu rtsa bdun pa /
analyzed: ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mig yongs su gtong ba na thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshad kyi mig gi chos sems can thams cad yongs su bsngo ba la nye bar 'god do // bam po sum cu rtsa bdun pa /
translated: In this way, when the bodhisattva mahāsattva gives his eyes, he dedicates to all sentient beings the Dharma eye of omniscience.

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji ltar rgyal po khyad par du 'gro ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' mdud pa med pa'i spyi gtsug gis yongs su btang ba bzhin du slong bar nye bar 'ongs pa la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa blangs pa'i sems dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji ltar rgyal po khyad par du 'gro ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' mdud pa med pa'i spyi gtsug gis yongs su btang ba bzhin du slong bar nye bar 'ongs pa la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa blangs pa'i sems dang /
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, like King Viśeṣagāmin and the bodhisattva Acalapārśva, gives his eyes to those who come to ask for them, with a mind that has taken up the bodhisattva conduct.

original: de bzhin gshegs @264a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs @264a *//
translated: The Tathāgata

original: pa'i rigs su rigs dang ldan par byung bas sangs rgyas kyi rigs su byung ba'i sbyin pa'i sems dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad rjes su dran pa'i spyod pa la brtson pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu mthun par skyes pa dang /
analyzed: pa'i rigs su rigs dang ldan par byung bas sangs rgyas kyi rigs su byung ba'i sbyin pa'i sems dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad rjes su dran pa'i spyod pa la brtson pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu mthun par skyes pa dang /
translated: the mind of birth in accord with the enlightenment of the Buddha;🔽the mind of purity through the faculties, gnosis, and qualities; the mind of the realization of the essence of the three impure realms as being without essence;

original: dbang po dang / ye shes dang / yon tan gyis shin tu btsun pa dang / khams gsum ma dag cang snying po med pa la snying por rab tu rtog pa dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' blta ba rab tu thob pas rang gi lus la chags pa med pa'i sems dang /
analyzed: dbang po dang / ye shes dang / yon tan gyis shin tu btsun pa dang / khams gsum ma dag cang snying po med pa la snying por rab tu rtog pa dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' blta ba rab tu thob pas rang gi lus la chags pa med pa'i sems dang /
translated: the mind of nonattachment to one’s own body through obtaining the vision of the Buddha and bodhisattvas;

original: gnas med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rjes su dran par gnas pa dang / rdul ba dang / zhi ba'i sems dang / dbang po'i rgyu ba shin tu zhi ba dang / 'gro ba'i mya ngan thams cad nas sems can thams cad gdon par sems pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'i shes rab dang /
analyzed: gnas med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rjes su dran par gnas pa dang / rdul ba dang / zhi ba'i sems dang / dbang po'i rgyu ba shin tu zhi ba dang / 'gro ba'i mya ngan thams cad nas sems can thams cad gdon par sems pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'i shes rab dang /
translated: It is to abide in the recollection of all the qualities of the buddhas that are not based on anything. It is to have a peaceful mind that is free from dust. It is to have very peaceful faculties. It is the wisdom that gives rise to the knowledge that all beings should be liberated from all the sufferings of saṃsāra.

original: bsod nams kyi 'byung gnas dang / rgyud ched du brjod pa rgya mtshos gtong ba'i sems yangs par byas pa dang / don la rnam par nges pa'i chos dang / mgon po thams cad kyi lam du 'jug pa dang / chos kyi dbang phyug la ye shes kyis spyod pa dang /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi 'byung gnas dang / rgyud ched du brjod pa rgya mtshos gtong ba'i sems yangs par byas pa dang / don la rnam par nges pa'i chos dang / mgon po thams cad kyi lam du 'jug pa dang / chos kyi dbang phyug la ye shes kyis spyod pa dang /
translated: It is the vast mind of giving that is the source of merit and the ocean of the expressions of joy. It is the Dharma that is certain with regard to its meaning. It is to enter the path of all the lords. It is the wisdom that is engaged in the lord of the Dharma.

original: rang gi lus snying po med pa las snying po blang pa'i blos yongs su gtong ba'i tshe rna ba dang / sna yongs su btang bas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de 'di ltar yongs @264b su bsngo ste /
analyzed: rang gi lus snying po med pa las snying po blang pa'i blos yongs su gtong ba'i tshe rna ba dang / sna yongs su btang bas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de 'di ltar yongs @264b su bsngo ste /
translated: When, with the intention of taking the essence from one’s own body, which is without essence, one gives away one’s ears and nose, one should dedicate the resulting wholesome action in the following way:

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad chos thams cad kyi sgra rnam par rig par bya ba la chags pa med pa'i rna ba dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad chos thams cad kyi sgra rnam par rig par bya ba la chags pa med pa'i rna ba dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: ‘By this wholesome action, may all sentient beings have ears that are unobstructed with regard to the sounds of all phenomena.

original: sems can thams cad kyis sgra thams cad skad ji lta ba bzhin du shes par bya ba'i phyir bsgribs pa med pa'i rna ba dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis sgra thams cad skad ji lta ba bzhin du shes par bya ba'i phyir bsgribs pa med pa'i rna ba dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have ears that are unobscured, so that they can understand all sounds according to their language.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi snyan dang ldan pas thogs pa med pa'i rna ba dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi snyan dang ldan pas thogs pa med pa'i rna ba dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have unobstructed ears, having the ears of the Buddha.

original: sems can thams cad rna ba'i skye mched shin tu bsgoms pas rna ba rnam par dag par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad rna ba'i skye mched shin tu bsgoms pas rna ba rnam par dag par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have pure ears, having well-cultivated the sense base of the ear.’

original: sems can thams cad rnam par shes pa zhi ba skye ba'i phyir bsgribs pa med pa'i rna ba dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad rnam par shes pa zhi ba skye ba'i phyir bsgribs pa med pa'i rna ba dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have unobstructed ears, in order to give rise to the peace of consciousness.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsung khong du chud pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings la gzhol ba'i rna ba dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsung khong du chud pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings la gzhol ba'i rna ba dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have ears that are directed toward the realm of phenomena, in order to comprehend the speech of all the buddhas.

original: sems can thams cad bsgribs pa med pa'i chos rnam par rig par bya ba'i phyir gnas med pa'i rna ba dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad bsgribs pa med pa'i chos rnam par rig par bya ba'i phyir gnas med pa'i rna ba dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have ears that are without location, in order to be aware of the unobstructed Dharma.

original: sems can thams cad phyir rgol ba 'jig par byed pa'i shes pa la mi phyed pa'i rna ba dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad phyir rgol ba 'jig par byed pa'i shes pa la mi phyed pa'i rna ba dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have ears that are indivisible, in order to have knowledge that destroys opponents.

original: sems can thams cad rna ba shin tu dag pa la dbang sgyur bas kun tu 'jug pa'i rna ba dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad rna ba shin tu dag pa la dbang sgyur bas kun tu 'jug pa'i rna ba dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have ears that are engaged, in order to have control over very pure ears.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi snyan rang tu 'thob par bya ba thob pas lha'i rna ba rab tu thob par gyur cig /🔽ces de ltar byang chub @265a *//🔽sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rna ba yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyi rna ba rnam par dag pa'i phyir yongs su bsngos nas sna rnam par dag par yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi snyan rang tu 'thob par bya ba thob pas lha'i rna ba rab tu thob par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub @265a *// sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rna ba yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyi rna ba rnam par dag pa'i phyir yongs su bsngos nas sna rnam par dag par yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: May all sentient beings attain the divine ear, which is the Buddha’s own ear.🔽In this way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, having given away his ears, dedicates the wholesome roots gathered thereby to the purification of the ears of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad legs par mtho ba'i sna dang / dpe byad bzang po'i sna dang / mtshan bzang po'i sna dang / shin tu yid du 'ong pa'i sna dang / rnam par dag pa'i sna dang / rim gyis gzhol ba'i sna dang / mdzes par 'phags pa'i sna dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad legs par mtho ba'i sna dang / dpe byad bzang po'i sna dang / mtshan bzang po'i sna dang / shin tu yid du 'ong pa'i sna dang / rnam par dag pa'i sna dang / rim gyis gzhol ba'i sna dang / mdzes par 'phags pa'i sna dang /
translated: He dedicates them to the purification of the nose, so that all sentient beings may have a well-formed nose, a nose with the major marks, a nose with the minor marks, a very pleasant nose, a pure nose, a nose that is gradually tapered, a nose that is beautiful and prominent,

original: dgra thams cad rab tu 'dul ba'i sna dang / ngo blta na sdug pa'i sna dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi shangs rab tu 'thob pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o //🔽sems can thams cad ngo la mi sdug pa med pa dang / chos thams cad kyi ngo dang / chags pa med pa'i ngo dang / blta na sdug pa'i ngo dang / mi mthun pa med pa'i ngo dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ngo dang /
analyzed: dgra thams cad rab tu 'dul ba'i sna dang / ngo blta na sdug pa'i sna dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi shangs rab tu 'thob pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o // sems can thams cad ngo la mi sdug pa med pa dang / chos thams cad kyi ngo dang / chags pa med pa'i ngo dang / blta na sdug pa'i ngo dang / mi mthun pa med pa'i ngo dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ngo dang /
translated: I dedicate it all so that all enemies may be completely subdued, so that all beings may have a beautiful face, and so that they may attain the nose of the Tathagata, the nose of a Buddha.🔽I dedicate it all so that all beings may have a face that is never ugly, a face that is the face of all the teachings, a face that is free of attachment, a face that is beautiful to behold, a face that is never disagreeable, a face that is completely pure,

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i ngo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhal gyi dkyil 'khor lta bu'i ngo dang / kun nas lta ba'i ngo dang / yid du 'ong zhing tshad med pa'i ngo dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i ngo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhal gyi dkyil 'khor lta bu'i ngo dang / kun nas lta ba'i ngo dang / yid du 'ong zhing tshad med pa'i ngo dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: a face that is irreproachable, a face that is like the face of the Tathagata, a face that is seen all around, a face that is pleasing and immeasurable.

original: ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rna ba dang / sna yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams @265b cad la yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rna ba dang / sna yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams @265b cad la yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva dedicates those roots of virtue gathered through giving away his ears and nose to all sentient beings.

original: ci nas kyang sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad shin tu 'dus par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad shin tu shes par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: ci nas kyang sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad shin tu 'dus par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad shin tu shes par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: He dedicates them so that all sentient beings will engage with all the qualities of the buddhas, so that all sentient beings will gather all the qualities of the buddhas, so that all sentient beings will understand all the qualities of the buddhas,

original: ci nas kyang sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la shin tu 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad shin tu mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sgo khong du chud par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: ci nas kyang sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la shin tu 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad shin tu mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sgo khong du chud par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: in order that all sentient beings may enter into all the qualities of the Buddha,🔽in order that all sentient beings may see all the Tathagatas,🔽in order that all sentient beings may understand the doors of the Dharma of the Buddha,🔽in order that all sentient beings may attain the purity of being utterly invincible,

original: ci nas kyang sems can thams cad shin tu zil gyis mi non pa'i yongs su dag pa thob par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la snang ba rab tu 'thob par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: ci nas kyang sems can thams cad shin tu zil gyis mi non pa'i yongs su dag pa thob par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la snang ba rab tu 'thob par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: in order that all sentient beings may attain the illumination of all the qualities of the Buddha,

original: ci nas kyang sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su dag par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i lus dang ldan par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o //🔽'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skyid pa zil gyis mi non pa'i sa la gnas te au dum war ltar shin tu dkon @266a *//
analyzed: ci nas kyang sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su dag par 'gyur ba dang / ci nas kyang sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i lus dang ldan par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o // 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skyid pa zil gyis mi non pa'i sa la gnas te au dum war ltar shin tu dkon @266a *//
translated: I dedicate these roots of virtue in such a way that all sentient beings will purify all buddha-fields.🔽I dedicate these roots of virtue in such a way that all sentient beings will have bodies blessed by all the Tathāgatas.

original: par sems pa'i sems rnam par dag pa dang / gtong ba mi dad cing 'byams klas pa dang / dad cing rlung sprugs te btang ba'i sems dang / yongs su gtong ba'i blo mtha' yas pa dang / dul ba dang / yongs su dul ba'i yid kyis gtong ba'i dbang po dang /
analyzed: par sems pa'i sems rnam par dag pa dang / gtong ba mi dad cing 'byams klas pa dang / dad cing rlung sprugs te btang ba'i sems dang / yongs su gtong ba'i blo mtha' yas pa dang / dul ba dang / yongs su dul ba'i yid kyis gtong ba'i dbang po dang /
