analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sems rgyun mi 'chad pa dang ldan pa /
translated: they had minds that were irreversible and uninterrupted;

original: bdag gi lus la phangs par mi lta ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: bdag gi lus la phangs par mi lta ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: they had minds that did not think of their own bodies as precious;

original: de ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi 'byung gnas dang / rgyal po yid bde bar sems pa dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan grangs med pa dag kyang skye ba'i skye gnas de dang de dag la gnas shing khrag yongs su gtong bar gyur pa de ltar slong ba rnams la rang gi lus kyi khrag gtong ba'i tshe khrag
analyzed: de ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi 'byung gnas dang / rgyal po yid bde bar sems pa dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan grangs med pa dag kyang skye ba'i skye gnas de dang de dag la gnas shing khrag yongs su gtong bar gyur pa de ltar slong ba rnams la rang gi lus kyi khrag gtong ba'i tshe khrag
translated: “How is it that the bodhisattvas Dharmākara, King Sāgara, and other innumerable bodhisattva mahāsattvas, while dwelling in their respective places of birth, give their blood?

original: yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: When they give their blood to beggars, they dedicate that root of virtue, which is gathered through giving blood, in the following way:

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad chos dang ye @272a *//
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad chos dang ye @272a *//
translated: ‘Through this root of virtue, may all sentient beings have the body of Dharma and wisdom,

original: shes kyi lus dang ldan zhing byang chub sems dpa'i lus phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: shes kyi lus dang ldan zhing byang chub sems dpa'i lus phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: and may they have the perfect body of a bodhisattva.

original: sems can thams cad rdo rje'i snying po dang 'dra bar dge sbyong gi lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad rdo rje'i snying po dang 'dra bar dge sbyong gi lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have the body of an ascetic, like the essence of a vajra.

original: sems can thams cad lus nyams pa med cing dag pa dang ldan te lus la rma med par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad lus nyams pa med cing dag pa dang ldan te lus la rma med par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have pure bodies, free from any physical defects.

original: sems can thams cad 'jig rten gyis mi 'phrog pa'i sems dang ldan zhing sprul pa lta bu'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'jig rten gyis mi 'phrog pa'i sems dang ldan zhing sprul pa lta bu'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have bodies like magical illusions, their minds untroubled by worldly things.

original: sems can thams cad 'od dang ba'i lus nyams pa med pa dang ldan zhing yid du 'ong ba'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'od dang ba'i lus nyams pa med pa dang ldan zhing yid du 'ong ba'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have bodies that are radiant, free from any physical defects, and pleasing to the mind.

original: sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mi gnas pa dang ldan zhing chos kyi dbyings su mngon par skyes pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mi gnas pa dang ldan zhing chos kyi dbyings su mngon par skyes pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have bodies that are born from the realm of phenomena, bodies that are not subject to the way of the thus-gone ones.

original: sems can thams cad gzhan thams cad lus thams cad la rim gro byed pa'i lus dang ldan zhing rin po che lta bu'i 'od yod pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad gzhan thams cad lus thams cad la rim gro byed pa'i lus dang ldan zhing rin po che lta bu'i 'od yod pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have bodies that are like jewels, bodies that serve all others in every way.

original: sems can thams cad 'chi ba med pa'i dbyings su chos kyi skyid pa la dbang sgyur ba'i lus dang ldan zhing ye shes dam pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'chi ba med pa'i dbyings su chos kyi skyid pa la dbang sgyur ba'i lus dang ldan zhing ye shes dam pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have bodies that are able to control the happiness of the Dharma in the realm of immortality, and may they have the bodies of sublime wisdom.

original: sems can thams cad 'gro ba kun gyis blta na don yod par skyes pas rin po che rgya mtsho lta bu'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'gro ba kun gyis blta na don yod par skyes pas rin po che rgya mtsho lta bu'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have bodies like the ocean of jewels, born in a way that is meaningful to all who see them.

original: sems can thams cad 'jig rten kun gyi gtse bas gos pa med cing bar @272b snang gi rang bzhin gyi lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'jig rten kun gyi gtse bas gos pa med cing bar @272b snang gi rang bzhin gyi lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have bodies that are the nature of space, untainted by the defilements of the whole world.

original: ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang gi lus las khrag gi sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe ye shes kyi theg pa dang / theg pa chen po la rab tu gzhol ba'i sems kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o //🔽dag pa'i yid kyis yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang gi lus las khrag gi sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe ye shes kyi theg pa dang / theg pa chen po la rab tu gzhol ba'i sems kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o // dag pa'i yid kyis yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: In this way, when the bodhisattva mahāsattvas give the gift of their own blood, they dedicate those wholesome roots with a mind that is intent on the vehicle of wisdom and the Great Vehicle.🔽They dedicate them with a pure mind.

original: yangs pa'i yid kyis yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: yangs pa'i yid kyis yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: They dedicate them with an expansive mind.

original: dga' ba'i yid kyis yongs su bsngo'o //🔽rangs pa'i yid kyis yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: dga' ba'i yid kyis yongs su bsngo'o // rangs pa'i yid kyis yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: I dedicate with a joyful mind.🔽I dedicate with a delighted mind.

original: spro ba'i yid kyis yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: spro ba'i yid kyis yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: I dedicate with an elated mind.

original: zhum pa med pa'i yid kyis yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: zhum pa med pa'i yid kyis yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: I dedicate with an undaunted mind.

original: bde ba'i yid kyis yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i yid kyis yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: I dedicate with a happy mind.

original: dang ba'i yid kyis yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: dang ba'i yid kyis yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: I dedicate with a clear mind.

original: mgu ba'i yid dang / rab tu dga' ba'i yid dang / yid bde zhing rangs pa skyes pas dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: mgu ba'i yid dang / rab tu dga' ba'i yid dang / yid bde zhing rangs pa skyes pas dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: I dedicate these roots of virtue with a mind that is pleased, delighted, and overjoyed.

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gtong ba'i sems gzhal du med pa'i dga' bas rnam par 'phel ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang mkhas pa'i skye bos bsten pa'i zla med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dam pa 'jig rten gyi dri ma bsal ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gtong ba'i sems gzhal du med pa'i dga' bas rnam par 'phel ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang mkhas pa'i skye bos bsten pa'i zla med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dam pa 'jig rten gyi dri ma bsal ba dang /
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva increases with immeasurable joy the mind of generosity, and with roots of virtue that are unmatched and relied upon by wise beings, he purifies the supreme intention and the stains of the world.

original: slong ba thams cad kyis zad par mi nus pa'i nang gi lus nye bar blangs pa'i yongs su gtong ba dang / yon tan rin po ches yang dag par blangs pa'i dge ba 'byams klas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi yi dam gyis nye bar blangs pa'i sbyin pa'i tshogs chen po dang /
analyzed: slong ba thams cad kyis zad par mi nus pa'i nang gi lus nye bar blangs pa'i yongs su gtong ba dang / yon tan rin po ches yang dag par blangs pa'i dge ba 'byams klas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi yi dam gyis nye bar blangs pa'i sbyin pa'i tshogs chen po dang /
translated: the generosity of taking on the inexhaustible inner body for all beggars; the boundless virtue of taking on the jewel of good qualities; the great accumulation of generosity taken on by the commitment of all bodhisattvas;

original: slong ba thams cad kyi yid kyis 'dod par bsam pa @273a *//
analyzed: slong ba thams cad kyi yid kyis 'dod par bsam pa @273a *//
translated: the mental wish to give to all beggars;

original: btang yang 'gyod pa med pa'i sems dang / sbyin pa la dmigs pa'i dngos pos shin tu brtags pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa'i rten dang / len pa rnams la sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i sems nyams pa med pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad mngon du gyur pa pha lta bu'i 'du shes su mngon par 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: btang yang 'gyod pa med pa'i sems dang / sbyin pa la dmigs pa'i dngos pos shin tu brtags pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa'i rten dang / len pa rnams la sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i sems nyams pa med pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad mngon du gyur pa pha lta bu'i 'du shes su mngon par 'dzin pa dang /
translated: the mental state of non-remorse even when giving; the basis of the maturation of karma that is well examined by the entity that is the focus of generosity; the undiminished mental state of giving gifts to those who receive them; the perception of all buddhas as being like one’s father;

original: 'gro ba thams cad la mngon du gyur pa'i sems can thams cad rnam par dag pa la gnas pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad mngon du gyur pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan thams cad dang / 'gro ba thams cad la mngon du gyur pa'i snying rje chen pos yongs su skyob pa dang /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad la mngon du gyur pa'i sems can thams cad rnam par dag pa la gnas pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad mngon du gyur pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan thams cad dang / 'gro ba thams cad la mngon du gyur pa'i snying rje chen pos yongs su skyob pa dang /
translated: the purification of all beings who are present to all beings, the adornment of all buddhafields that are present in all world systems, the protection of all beings by great compassion that is present to all beings,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub la mngon du gyur pa'i stobs bcu rnam par spyod pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mngon du gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mthun pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub la mngon du gyur pa'i stobs bcu rnam par spyod pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mngon du gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mthun pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang /
translated: the experience of the ten powers that are present in the enlightenment of all buddhas, the completion of the roots of virtue that are present in all the bodhisattvas of the past, future, and present,

original: mi 'jigs pa thams cad mngon du gyur pa'i khyu mchog dang / sengge'i nga ro bsgrags pa dang / dus gsum mngon du gyur pa'i dus thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / dus gsum thams cad mngon du gyur pa'i phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal par thug par zhe non pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam dang /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa thams cad mngon du gyur pa'i khyu mchog dang / sengge'i nga ro bsgrags pa dang / dus gsum mngon du gyur pa'i dus thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / dus gsum thams cad mngon du gyur pa'i phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal par thug par zhe non pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam dang /
translated: the supreme leader who has actualized all fearlessnesses, the lion’s roar, the wisdom of the equality of all times that has actualized the three times, the bodhisattva’s aspiration that has actualized all the three times and will continue until the end of time,🔽and the generation of the mind that has actualized the absence of complete despair.

original: yongs su yid chad pa med pas mngon du gyur pa'i sems bskyed pa grangs med pas de ji ltar @273b byang chub sems dpa' phan pa tshol ba dang / rgyal po thams cad gtong ba dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan grangs med pa dag kyang skye ba'i skye mched sna tshogs dag na gnas shing sha dang /
analyzed: yongs su yid chad pa med pas mngon du gyur pa'i sems bskyed pa grangs med pas de ji ltar @273b byang chub sems dpa' phan pa tshol ba dang / rgyal po thams cad gtong ba dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan grangs med pa dag kyang skye ba'i skye mched sna tshogs dag na gnas shing sha dang /
translated: “In that way, the bodhisattva who seeks benefit, the king who gives everything, and other innumerable bodhisattva mahāsattvas, in various places of birth, give away their flesh, blood, bones, marrow,

original: rkang yongs su gtong ba de lta slong ba rnams la lus las sha dang / rkang yongs su gtong ba'i tshe sha dang / rkang yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: rkang yongs su gtong ba de lta slong ba rnams la lus las sha dang / rkang yongs su gtong ba'i tshe sha dang / rkang yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: When they give away their flesh and blood, they dedicate the wholesome roots gathered by giving away their flesh and blood to all sentient beings in this way:

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di sems can thams cad rdo rje'i snying po ltar mkhregs pa'i yan lag dang ldan zhing mi shigs pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di sems can thams cad rdo rje'i snying po ltar mkhregs pa'i yan lag dang ldan zhing mi shigs pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: “By this wholesome root, may all sentient beings have indestructible bodies, with limbs as hard as diamond.

original: sems can thams cad gsob med pa'i lus rab tu thob pas gsog ma yin pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /🔽sems can thams cad yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus rnam par dag pa dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: sems can thams cad gsob med pa'i lus rab tu thob pas gsog ma yin pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus rnam par dag pa dang ldan zhing /
translated: May all sentient beings have bodies that are not hollow, with bodies that are not empty.

original: sangs rgyas kyis brgyan pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis brgyan pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have bodies adorned with the Buddha, with bodies that are the pure nature of mind.

original: sems can thams cad mtshan sum cu gnyis kyis lus shin tu grub pas bsod nams brgya pa'i mtshan gyi lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad mtshan sum cu gnyis kyis lus shin tu grub pas bsod nams brgya pa'i mtshan gyi lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings attain a body endowed with the marks of a hundred merits, with their bodies well adorned with the thirty-two marks.

original: sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu tha mi dad cing ma nyams pa dang ldan te dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus rnam par bris pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu tha mi dad cing ma nyams pa dang ldan te dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus rnam par bris pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings attain a body adorned with the eighty minor marks, endowed with the ten powers of the Tathagata, without any deficiency.

original: sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rab tu thob pas mtha' las 'das pa tshad med pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /🔽sems can thams cad bdud thams cad kyi dkrug @274a *//
analyzed: sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rab tu thob pas mtha' las 'das pa tshad med pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad bdud thams cad kyi dkrug @274a *//
translated: May all sentient beings attain a body beyond measure, having attained the body of the Tathagata.

original: ma rab tu 'joms pas kun tu khyab pa'i spyod lam dang ldan zhing thub pa med pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: ma rab tu 'joms pas kun tu khyab pa'i spyod lam dang ldan zhing thub pa med pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have a body that is invincible, with a conduct that pervades the total defeat of all the Maras.

original: sems can thams cad 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang lus gcig par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang lus gcig par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have a body that is the same as that of all the Buddhas of the past, present, and future.

original: sems can thams cad nam mkha'i dbyings kun tu chos kyi skus khyab par byed pa'i phyir chags pa med pa'i lus mngon par grub par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad nam mkha'i dbyings kun tu chos kyi skus khyab par byed pa'i phyir chags pa med pa'i lus mngon par grub par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings attain a body that is free from attachment, pervading the realm of space with the dharmakāya.

original: sems can thams cad 'gro ba thams cad shong ba'i lus dang ldan zhing byang chub kyi lus dam pa dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'gro ba thams cad shong ba'i lus dang ldan zhing byang chub kyi lus dam pa dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have a body that can contain all beings and attain the excellent body of enlightenment.

original: ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad mkhyen par dmigs pa'i sems dang ldan pa slong ba la sha dang rkang yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi sku mtha' las 'das pa
analyzed: ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad mkhyen par dmigs pa'i sems dang ldan pa slong ba la sha dang rkang yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi sku mtha' las 'das pa
translated: In this way, when the bodhisattva mahāsattva who has the mind focused on omniscience gives away his flesh and bones to beggars, he dedicates those roots of virtue to all sentient beings so that they may attain the infinite,

original: tshad med pa rnam par dag pa rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa rnam par dag pa rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: incalculable, and pure bodies of the buddhas.

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i rgyud la bslab pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i rgyud la bslab pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who has the mind trained in the continuum of generosity

original: sbyin pa thams cad byin pas spyod pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sbyin pa thams cad byin pas spyod pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: He had the attitude of practicing generosity to all.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa chen po thob pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa chen po thob pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: He had the attitude of attaining the great perfection of generosity.

original: pha rol tu 'gro ba'i sbyin pa grub pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: pha rol tu 'gro ba'i sbyin pa grub pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: He had the attitude of generosity that has crossed over to the other side.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis byin pa'i rjes su bslab pa'i sems dang ldan pa /🔽sbyin pa dang yongs su gtong ba thams cad kyi zad mi @274b shes pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis byin pa'i rjes su bslab pa'i sems dang ldan pa / sbyin pa dang yongs su gtong ba thams cad kyi zad mi @274b shes pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: He had the attitude of following the generosity of all bodhisattvas.🔽He had the attitude of the inexhaustible generosity of all giving and letting go.

original: sbyin pa'i gnas thams cad la shin tu gnas pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gnas thams cad la shin tu gnas pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: He had the attitude of being completely present for all who are the objects of generosity.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi sbyin pa'i las pa rab tu gnas pa de sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi sbyin pa'i las pa rab tu gnas pa de sems dang ldan pa /
translated: He had the attitude of being present for the activity of generosity of all bodhisattvas.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad yid la bya bas mngon du gyur pa'i gtong ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad yid la bya bas mngon du gyur pa'i gtong ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: He had the attitude of letting go that is present through attending to all buddhas.

original: slong ba thams cad rgyun mi 'chad par rgyu ba rab tu mchod dang sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: slong ba thams cad rgyun mi 'chad par rgyu ba rab tu mchod dang sems dang ldan pa /
translated: He had the attitude of making offerings to all beggars who are constantly moving.

original: de ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' yongs su skyo ba med pa dang / rgyal po g-yo ba med pa dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan grangs med pa dag gis kyang snying yongs su btang bar gyur pa de ltar slong ba kun las 'ongs pa rnams kyis bslangs shing rang gi lus las snying yongs su gtong zhing sbyin pa byed pa
analyzed: de ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' yongs su skyo ba med pa dang / rgyal po g-yo ba med pa dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan grangs med pa dag gis kyang snying yongs su btang bar gyur pa de ltar slong ba kun las 'ongs pa rnams kyis bslangs shing rang gi lus las snying yongs su gtong zhing sbyin pa byed pa
translated: In that way, when all the beggars came and asked, they gave away their hearts from their own bodies and made gifts of them.

original: dang / spong ba dang / thob par byed pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par sbyong ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad rab tu dgrol ba'i phyir stobs bcu'i byang chub la dmigs par byed pa dang / smon lam chen pos nan tan du byed pa dang /
analyzed: dang / spong ba dang / thob par byed pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par sbyong ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad rab tu dgrol ba'i phyir stobs bcu'i byang chub la dmigs par byed pa dang / smon lam chen pos nan tan du byed pa dang /
translated: They abandoned, attained, purified their superior intention, and focused on the enlightenment of the ten powers in order to liberate all beings. They were diligent in their great aspirations.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la yang dag par gnas pa dang / smon lam yongs su mi gtong bas sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste; sems can thams cad rdo rje'i rang bzhin lta bus yongs su bzung ba'i snying dpal gyi be'us brgyan pa dang ldan
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la yang dag par gnas pa dang / smon lam yongs su mi gtong bas sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste; sems can thams cad rdo rje'i rang bzhin lta bus yongs su bzung ba'i snying dpal gyi be'us brgyan pa dang ldan
translated: When they practice generosity, they dedicate those roots of virtue to all sentient beings, so that they may be protected by the vajra-like nature of their hearts, which are adorned with the auspicious mark of a navel.

original: zhing rdo rje'i ri 'khor yug thams cad ltar mi shigs shing rdo rje'i snying po @275a *//
analyzed: zhing rdo rje'i ri 'khor yug thams cad ltar mi shigs shing rdo rje'i snying po @275a *//
translated: When they practice generosity, they dedicate those wholesome roots to all sentient beings, so that they may be endowed with the heart of a vajra, with the heart of a vajra-encircled mountain, with an indestructible heart, with a vajra-like heart,

original: lta bu'i snying dang ldan pa dang / bag tsha ba med pa'i snying dang / thub par dka' ba'i snying dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyis mi 'phrog pa'i snying dang / dpa' ba'i rgyal mtshan ye shes kyi snying po can gyi snying dang / mthu bo che chen po dam pa'i sems kyi rgyal mtshan can gyi snying dang /
analyzed: lta bu'i snying dang ldan pa dang / bag tsha ba med pa'i snying dang / thub par dka' ba'i snying dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyis mi 'phrog pa'i snying dang / dpa' ba'i rgyal mtshan ye shes kyi snying po can gyi snying dang / mthu bo che chen po dam pa'i sems kyi rgyal mtshan can gyi snying dang /
translated: with a heart that is fearless, with a heart that is invincible, with a heart that is not carried away by the whole world, with a heart that is the banner of heroism, with the essence of wisdom, with a heart that is the banner of the mind of the highest great strength,

original: 'gro ba thams cad kyi gtso bo lta bur mi 'phrog pa'i snying dang / mthu bo che ltar mi shigs pa'i snying po can gyi snying dang / bdud kyi las dang / bdud kyi dpung dang / bdud kyi sde rnam par 'joms pa'i snying dang /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad kyi gtso bo lta bur mi 'phrog pa'i snying dang / mthu bo che ltar mi shigs pa'i snying po can gyi snying dang / bdud kyi las dang / bdud kyi dpung dang / bdud kyi sde rnam par 'joms pa'i snying dang /
translated: a heart that is like the chief of all beings, an invincible heart; a heart that is like a great powerful being, a heart with an indestructible essence; a heart that conquers the works of Māra, the armies of Māra, and the hordes of Māra;

original: brtan pa'i snying dang / gzengs mtho ba'i snying dang / dpa' ba'i snying dang / rtul phod pa'i snying dang / mi 'jigs mi dngangs skrag par mi 'gyur ba'i snying dang / rdo rje'i go cha chen po yang dag par bgos pa'i snying dang / shin tu btsun pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i snying dang /
analyzed: brtan pa'i snying dang / gzengs mtho ba'i snying dang / dpa' ba'i snying dang / rtul phod pa'i snying dang / mi 'jigs mi dngangs skrag par mi 'gyur ba'i snying dang / rdo rje'i go cha chen po yang dag par bgos pa'i snying dang / shin tu btsun pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i snying dang /
translated: a heart that is steadfast, a heart that is lofty, a heart that is heroic, a heart that is valiant, a heart that is fearless, unperturbed, and unalarmed, a heart that is clad in the great armor of vajra, a heart that is utterly pure;

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs pas byang chub snang bar gyur pa'i snying dang / byang chub kyi shing drung du 'dug nas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rjes su rtogs shing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs pas byang chub snang bar gyur pa'i snying dang / byang chub kyi shing drung du 'dug nas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rjes su rtogs shing /
translated: a heart that is illuminated by awakening, having perfected the qualities of a buddha; a heart that, sitting at the foot of the Bodhi tree, realizes all the qualities of a buddha;

original: rmongs pa med par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i snying dang / stobs bcu mngon par byang chub pa rab tu 'thob pa'i snying dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: rmongs pa med par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i snying dang / stobs bcu mngon par byang chub pa rab tu 'thob pa'i snying dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May they have the heart to attain omniscience without delusion, and the heart to attain the ten powers of complete enlightenment.

original: ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po snying gi sbyin pas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad 'gro ba thams cad @275b kyis gos pa med pa'i stobs bcu mnga' ba'i thugs phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po snying gi sbyin pas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad 'gro ba thams cad @275b kyis gos pa med pa'i stobs bcu mnga' ba'i thugs phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva dedicates those roots of virtue that are embraced by the gift of the heart so that all sentient beings may have the perfect mind of the one who possesses the ten powers, unstained by any world.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa dang ldan par yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa dang ldan par yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: He dedicates them so that they may be completely perfect.

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po slong ba mngon par dang par byed pa'i lta ba dang / gsal zhing dga' bar byed pa'i mig dang / byang chub dang mnyam par bya ba'i byams pa dang / ci 'dod pas slong ba phu dud du bya ba'i sbyin pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po slong ba mngon par dang par byed pa'i lta ba dang / gsal zhing dga' bar byed pa'i mig dang / byang chub dang mnyam par bya ba'i byams pa dang / ci 'dod pas slong ba phu dud du bya ba'i sbyin pa dang /
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should have the view of delighting in giving to beggars, the eyes of delighting in giving to beggars, the love of giving to beggars that is equal to enlightenment, the generosity of giving to beggars with whatever they desire,

original: rgyun mi 'chad par yid la byed pa'i gtong ba dang / lus la snying po med par rtogs pas snying po blang ba'i sems dang bar gyur pa'i lus rjes su dran pa yid la byed pa dang / spyang ki dang / wa dang / khyis bza' bar 'gyur ba'i lus su rab tu rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par yid la byed pa'i gtong ba dang / lus la snying po med par rtogs pas snying po blang ba'i sems dang bar gyur pa'i lus rjes su dran pa yid la byed pa dang / spyang ki dang / wa dang / khyis bza' bar 'gyur ba'i lus su rab tu rtogs pa dang /
translated: the giving that is continuously kept in mind, the mental state of taking the essence through realizing that the body is without essence, the mental state of recollecting the body that is filled with joy, and the realization that the body will be eaten by jackals, foxes, and dogs.

original: gzhan la rag lus shing lus mi rtag par yid la byed pa dang / lus kyi rgyus thams cad khong du chud pa dang / gzhan la dad pa'i sems dang / de lta bu'i chos de dag yid la bya ba la brtson pa de ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' legs par byin pa dang /🔽rgyal po sdig pa bsal ba dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan grangs med pa dag gis kyang slong ba rnams la rgyu ma dang / mchin pa dang / mkhal ma dang / glo ba yongs su btang bar gyur pa de ltar rgyu ma dang /
analyzed: gzhan la rag lus shing lus mi rtag par yid la byed pa dang / lus kyi rgyus thams cad khong du chud pa dang / gzhan la dad pa'i sems dang / de lta bu'i chos de dag yid la bya ba la brtson pa de ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' legs par byin pa dang / rgyal po sdig pa bsal ba dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan grangs med pa dag gis kyang slong ba rnams la rgyu ma dang / mchin pa dang / mkhal ma dang / glo ba yongs su btang bar gyur pa de ltar rgyu ma dang /
translated: They should contemplate how the body is impermanent and depends on others, and how the causes of the body are fully comprehended. They should have a mind of faith in others and be diligent in keeping in mind such qualities.

original: mchin pa dang / mkhal ma dang / glo ba yongs su gtong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' slong ba de dag la mi 'gal ba'i mig gis blta zhing 'di ltar sems bskyed de @276a *//
analyzed: mchin pa dang / mkhal ma dang / glo ba yongs su gtong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' slong ba de dag la mi 'gal ba'i mig gis blta zhing 'di ltar sems bskyed de @276a *//
translated: Just as the bodhisattvas Excellent Gift and King Dispeller of Evil, and countless other bodhisattva great beings, gave away their intestines, liver, lungs, and kidneys to those who asked, in the same way, when giving away their intestines, liver, lungs, and kidneys, bodhisattvas should look at those who ask with eyes free of hostility and arouse the following thought:

original: 'di ltar bdag gi lus mi rtag cing 'di ltar mi gtsang na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gi lus mi rtag cing 'di ltar mi gtsang na /
translated: In this way, since my body is impermanent and impure,

original: 'on kyang rgyu ma dang / mchin pa dang / mkhal ma dang / glo ba lta bu dag kyang slong ba dag la dgos pa ltas sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu ma dang / mchin pa dang / mkhal ma dang / glo ba lta bu dag kyang slong ba dag la dgos pa ltas sbyin par bya'o //
translated: I will give to those who ask for it, even my intestines, liver, kidneys, and lungs, as if they were some kind of food.

original: zhes de lta bur yid la byed cing dga' ba'i rgyu dang / de ltar chos nyid shes pa'i bsam pa dang / slong ba mthong ba dge ba'i bshes gnyen du 'du shes pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis lus snying po med pa de las snying po blang bar 'dod de /
analyzed: zhes de lta bur yid la byed cing dga' ba'i rgyu dang / de ltar chos nyid shes pa'i bsam pa dang / slong ba mthong ba dge ba'i bshes gnyen du 'du shes pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis lus snying po med pa de las snying po blang bar 'dod de /
translated: In this way, with a mind that is joyful, that understands reality, and that is transformed by the perception of those who ask for something as being spiritual teachers, he wishes to take the essence from this body, which is without essence.

original: de lta bur yid la byed cing rab tu rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis rgyu ma dang / mchin pa dang / mkhal ma dang / glo ba de dag yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: de lta bur yid la byed cing rab tu rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis rgyu ma dang / mchin pa dang / mkhal ma dang / glo ba de dag yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: With a mind that is thus oriented and that is full of understanding, when he gives away his intestines, liver, kidneys, and lungs, he dedicates the roots of virtue to all sentient beings in this way:

original: rgyu ma dang / mchin pa dang / mkhal ma dang / glo ba yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad ye shes kyi snying po'i lus dang ldan zhing lus kyi phyi nang shin tu gtsang zhing dag par gyur cig /
analyzed: rgyu ma dang / mchin pa dang / mkhal ma dang / glo ba yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad ye shes kyi snying po'i lus dang ldan zhing lus kyi phyi nang shin tu gtsang zhing dag par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have bodies that are the essence of wisdom, and may their bodies be completely pure, both inside and out.

original: sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i smon lam yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir ye shes kyi lto dang yang dag par ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i smon lam yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir ye shes kyi lto dang yang dag par ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have the belly of wisdom, in order to hold the prayers of omniscience.

original: sems can thams cad nang spos zhim po'i mchog thams cad dang ldan zhing phyi rol tu 'od zer rab tu 'gyed pas blta na bzang ba'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad nang spos zhim po'i mchog thams cad dang ldan zhing phyi rol tu 'od zer rab tu 'gyed pas blta na bzang ba'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have bodies that are beautiful to behold, with a radiant glow, and may they have the most exquisite inner fragrance.

original: sems can thams cad rim gyis gzhol zhing mnyam pa'i lus kyi yan @276b lag dang ldan te gzhu lta bu'i lto dang ldan pa'i lus su gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad rim gyis gzhol zhing mnyam pa'i lus kyi yan @276b lag dang ldan te gzhu lta bu'i lto dang ldan pa'i lus su gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have bodies that are gradually tapered, with limbs that are even, and may they have bodies that are like a bow.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi dga' bas lus shin tu bskyed pas lus chos kyi zas dang ye shes kyis gso bar gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi dga' bas lus shin tu bskyed pas lus chos kyi zas dang ye shes kyis gso bar gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings be nourished by the food of Dharma and by wisdom, their bodies well-developed through their delight in the Dharma of the Buddhas.

original: sems can thams cad dga' ba'i lus dang chos kyi lus kyis yang dag par spyod pa zad mi shes pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad dga' ba'i lus dang chos kyi lus kyis yang dag par spyod pa zad mi shes pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have bodies that are inexhaustible through their practice of the Dharma and the body of delight.

original: sems can thams cad tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa'i chos snang ba dang ldan pas gzungs kyi snying pos lus kyi nang rnam par dag par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa'i chos snang ba dang ldan pas gzungs kyi snying pos lus kyi nang rnam par dag par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have bodies that are pure within through the essence of retention, endowed with the light of Dharma that knows the distinctions.

original: sems can thams cad nang gi bsam pa'i rgyud shin tu sbyangs pas lus yongs su dag pa dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad nang gi bsam pa'i rgyud shin tu sbyangs pas lus yongs su dag pa dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have pure bodies, their inner continuums of thought well-purified.

original: sems can thams cad ye shes kyis ngom par byed pa'i chos kyi sprin gyi char rab tu 'bebs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang / ye shes kyi rnal 'byor khong du chud par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ye shes kyis ngom par byed pa'i chos kyi sprin gyi char rab tu 'bebs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang / ye shes kyi rnal 'byor khong du chud par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have the realization of the yoga of the body of the Tathagata and of wisdom, raining down the Dharma clouds of wisdom that satisfy.

original: sems can thams cad phyi rol gyi lus 'gro ba thams cad la ye shes kyi rgyal mtshan mdzes shing snang bar gyur pas nang gi lus dag cing zhi bar gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad phyi rol gyi lus 'gro ba thams cad la ye shes kyi rgyal mtshan mdzes shing snang bar gyur pas nang gi lus dag cing zhi bar gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have a beautiful and shining banner of pristine awareness, which is the external body of all beings, and may they have a pure and peaceful internal body.

original: ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rgyu ma dang / mchin pa dang / mkhal ma dang / glo ba de dag rang gi lus las slong ba rnams la yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyi lus phyi nang yongs su dag cing bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes la rab tu 'khod @277a *//🔽pa thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rgyu ma dang / mchin pa dang / mkhal ma dang / glo ba de dag rang gi lus las slong ba rnams la yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyi lus phyi nang yongs su dag cing bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes la rab tu 'khod @277a *//🔽pa thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: Thus, when the bodhisattva mahāsattva gives his liver, spleen, kidneys, and lungs to those who ask for them, he dedicates the roots of virtue to the attainment of the body of all sentient beings, which is pure inside and out and is seated in the pristine awareness that is free of obscurations.

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi 'byung gnas dang / rgyal po skar ma'i 'od dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan dag gis kyang yan lag dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi 'byung gnas dang / rgyal po skar ma'i 'od dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan dag gis kyang yan lag dang /
translated: In this way, bodhisattva great beings give their major and minor body parts and bones to those who ask for them, just as the bodhisattva great being Dharmôdgata, King Suvarṇaprabha, and other bodhisattva great beings did.

original: nying lag dang / rus pa slong ba rnams la yongs su btang bar gyur pa de ltar yan lag dang / nying lag dang / rus pa bslangs pa na slong ba rnams la gtong ba'i tshe slong ba mthong ma thag tu sems dga' ba dang /
analyzed: nying lag dang / rus pa slong ba rnams la yongs su btang bar gyur pa de ltar yan lag dang / nying lag dang / rus pa bslangs pa na slong ba rnams la gtong ba'i tshe slong ba mthong ma thag tu sems dga' ba dang /
translated: When they give their major and minor body parts and bones to those who ask for them, they feel joy,

original: sems mos pa dang / sems dad pa dang / sems rab tu spro ba dang / sems 'thad pa dang / byams pa'i sems dang / chags pa med pa'i sems dang / dag pa'i sems dang / slong ba rnams la rim gror bya ba'i sems rab tu 'thob ste /
analyzed: sems mos pa dang / sems dad pa dang / sems rab tu spro ba dang / sems 'thad pa dang / byams pa'i sems dang / chags pa med pa'i sems dang / dag pa'i sems dang / slong ba rnams la rim gror bya ba'i sems rab tu 'thob ste /
translated: interest, faith, delight, and approval in their hearts. They feel love, nonattachment, and purity, and they feel great respect for those who ask.

original: de yan lag dang / nying lag dang / rus pa de dag bslangs pas slong ba la yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: de yan lag dang / nying lag dang / rus pa de dag bslangs pas slong ba la yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: When he gives his limbs, fingers, and bones to those who ask for them, he dedicates the roots of virtue in this way:

original: rang gi lus kyi yan lag dang / nying lag dang / rus pa yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad rus pa dang / sha dang / khrag med pa'i lus dang ldan zhing sprul pa lta bu'i lus can du gyur cig /
analyzed: rang gi lus kyi yan lag dang / nying lag dang / rus pa yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad rus pa dang / sha dang / khrag med pa'i lus dang ldan zhing sprul pa lta bu'i lus can du gyur cig /
translated: “Through the roots of virtue gathered by giving away my limbs, fingers, and bones, may all sentient beings have bodies without bones, flesh, and blood, and may they have emanated bodies.

original: sems can thams @277b cad lus la thub pa med cing zil gyis mi non pas rdo rje lta bu'i stobs kyi lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams @277b cad lus la thub pa med cing zil gyis mi non pas rdo rje lta bu'i stobs kyi lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have bodies with the strength of vajra, with bodies that are invincible and unassailable.

original: sems can thams cad chags pa med cing grol ba dang / bcings pa med pa'i ye shes kyi lus kyis byung ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad chags pa med cing grol ba dang / bcings pa med pa'i ye shes kyi lus kyis byung ste /
translated: May all sentient beings have bodies of wisdom, free and liberated, without bondage or attachment.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs dang chos su ldan pa'i lus phun sum tshogs par gyur cig /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs dang chos su ldan pa'i lus phun sum tshogs par gyur cig /
translated: May they all have perfect bodies endowed with the strength and qualities of omniscience.

original: sems can thams cad dbang po tha mi dad cing gcad du med pa rab tu thob pas ye shes kyi stobs kyi lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad dbang po tha mi dad cing gcad du med pa rab tu thob pas ye shes kyi stobs kyi lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have bodies endowed with the strength of wisdom, having attained faculties that are not impaired or incomplete.

original: sems can thams cad ye shes kyi stobs dang / dbang gi pha rol tu phyin pa thob pas chos kyi stobs kyi lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ye shes kyi stobs dang / dbang gi pha rol tu phyin pa thob pas chos kyi stobs kyi lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have bodies endowed with the strength of the Dharma, having attained the strength and mastery of wisdom.

original: sems can thams cad lus shig shig po med pas yan lag shin tu brtan pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad lus shig shig po med pas yan lag shin tu brtan pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have bodies with limbs and joints that are very firm, without any weakness in their bodies.

original: par rnam par phye ba'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i sor mo dang ldan par gyur cig /🔽sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa snang bar bya ba la @281a *//
analyzed: par rnam par phye ba'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i sor mo dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa snang bar bya ba la @281a *//
translated: May all sentient beings have fingers that are like the fingers of the one with ten powers, fingers that are the ripening of his actions, fingers that are adorned with all the joints and limbs with beautiful lotuses and swastikas, fingers that are adorned with the ornaments of the major marks of a buddha.

original: brtson zhing / 'od zer gyi dra ba'i mdzod rab tu 'gyed ba'i sor mo dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: brtson zhing / 'od zer gyi dra ba'i mdzod rab tu 'gyed ba'i sor mo dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have fingers that radiate a treasury of nets of light rays, fingers that are dedicated to illuminating inexpressibly vast buddha realms.

original: sems can thams cad sor mo shin tu mdzes pa dra bas legs par 'brel ba dang ldan zhing sor mo legs pa dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sor mo shin tu mdzes pa dra bas legs par 'brel ba dang ldan zhing sor mo legs pa dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have beautiful fingers, well-knit fingers, and good fingers.

original: ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sor mo yongs su gtong ba'i tshe sems can thams cad rnam par dag par bya ba'i sems kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad sems can rnam la yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sor mo yongs su gtong ba'i tshe sems can thams cad rnam par dag par bya ba'i sems kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad sems can rnam la yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: In this way, when the bodhisattva great being gives away his fingers, he dedicates all those wholesome roots to all sentient beings, with a mind that is pure with regard to all sentient beings.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'dod pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'dod pa la /
translated: Moreover, when a bodhisattva great being is eager for the Dharma,

original: la la zhig gis chos thob par bya bar bsam ste des 'di skad du gal te khyod kyi sha dang bcas pa'i sen mo nga la byin na ni /
analyzed: la la zhig gis chos thob par bya bar bsam ste des 'di skad du gal te khyod kyi sha dang bcas pa'i sen mo nga la byin na ni /
translated: if someone were to say to him, “If you give me your flesh and nails,

original: ngas khyod la chos bstan par bya'o //🔽zhes zer pa zhig yod na /
analyzed: ngas khyod la chos bstan par bya'o // zhes zer pa zhig yod na /
translated: then I will teach you the Dharma,”

original: de la 'di skad du smras te /
analyzed: de la 'di skad du smras te /
translated: he would say to him,

original: bdag gi sha dang bcas pa'i sen mo ci bder khyer la bdag la chos bstan par mdzod cig /
analyzed: bdag gi sha dang bcas pa'i sen mo ci bder khyer la bdag la chos bstan par mdzod cig /
translated: “Take my flesh and nails as you wish and teach me the Dharma.”

original: ces ji ltar rgyal po dbang phyug tu gyur pa legs par bshad pa chol ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zad mi shes pa dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan tshad med pa chos kyi chos bzang po nyid la brtson pa /🔽'gro ba kun tu chos kyi lo shin tu legs pa yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir sha dang bcas pa'i sen @281b mo yongs su btang bar gyur pa de ltar slong ba rnams la rang gi sha dang bcas pa'i sen mo yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i
analyzed: ces ji ltar rgyal po dbang phyug tu gyur pa legs par bshad pa chol ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zad mi shes pa dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan tshad med pa chos kyi chos bzang po nyid la brtson pa / 'gro ba kun tu chos kyi lo shin tu legs pa yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir sha dang bcas pa'i sen @281b mo yongs su btang bar gyur pa de ltar slong ba rnams la rang gi sha dang bcas pa'i sen mo yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i
translated: Just as the king, who had become powerful, gave away his flesh and nails together with his skin, and the bodhisattva Inexhaustible gave away his flesh and nails together with his skin, and other bodhisattva great beings, who were not like him, gave away their flesh and nails together with their skin, in order to demonstrate the excellent Dharma to all beings,

original: rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: in the same way, when they give their flesh and nails together with their skin to beggars, they dedicate the roots of virtue to all sentient beings in the following way:

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi phyag sen rab tu grub cing /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi phyag sen rab tu grub cing /
translated: “May all sentient beings have the nails of a buddha,

original: zangs kyi kha dog lta bu'i sen mo dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: zangs kyi kha dog lta bu'i sen mo dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: and may they have nails the color of copper.”

original: sems can thams cad dpe byad bzang po'i sen mo rab tu thob cing mdog snum pa'i sen mo dang ldan par gyur cig /🔽sems can thams cad sen mo'i dam pa dang ldan zhing 'od 'tsher ba'i sen mo dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad dpe byad bzang po'i sen mo rab tu thob cing mdog snum pa'i sen mo dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sen mo'i dam pa dang ldan zhing 'od 'tsher ba'i sen mo dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings attain the excellent nails of the Buddha and have nails that are shiny.🔽May all sentient beings have the best nails and nails that shine with light.

original: sems can thams cad sen mo bzang po dang ldan zhing thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyag sen mo rab tu thob par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sen mo bzang po dang ldan zhing thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyag sen mo rab tu thob par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have excellent nails and attain the Buddha’s nails, which are omniscient.

original: sems can thams cad 'jig rten thams cad kyis mi gos shing mtshungs pa med pa'i sen mo dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'jig rten thams cad kyis mi gos shing mtshungs pa med pa'i sen mo dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have nails that are unstained by the whole world and be incomparable.

original: sems can thams cad 'od kyis snang bar bya ba la brtson zhing shin tu brgyan pa'i sen mo dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'od kyis snang bar bya ba la brtson zhing shin tu brgyan pa'i sen mo dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings be diligent in illuminating with light and have well-adorned nails.

original: sems can thams cad nyams pa med cing rnam par dag pa'i sen mo gang ba dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad nyams pa med cing rnam par dag pa'i sen mo gang ba dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have full and pure nails that are not defective.

original: sems can thams cad ye shes che zhing yangs pa rnam par dag pa dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ye shes che zhing yangs pa rnam par dag pa dang ldan zhing /
translated: May all sentient beings have vast and pure wisdom

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i mtshan dang ldan par gyur cig /🔽sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i las rnam par smin pas rnam par dag cing mdzes @282a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i mtshan dang ldan par gyur cig / sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i las rnam par smin pas rnam par dag cing mdzes @282a *//
translated: and have the major marks that are in accord with all the qualities of the buddhas.

original: par skyes pa'i sen mo dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: par skyes pa'i sen mo dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have nails and fingers that are beautiful and pure, the ripening of a bodhisattva’s karma.

original: sems can thams cad 'od zer kha dog mtha' yas pa rab tu 'gyed pa'i mdzod dang ldan zhing mgon po thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyag sen dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'od zer kha dog mtha' yas pa rab tu 'gyed pa'i mdzod dang ldan zhing mgon po thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyag sen dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have the hands of the omniscient lord, which emit infinite rays of light.

original: ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'dod pa'i phyir sen mo dang shar bcas pa yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku dang phyag sen gyi rgyan yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang /
analyzed: ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'dod pa'i phyir sen mo dang shar bcas pa yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku dang phyag sen gyi rgyan yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang /
translated: In this way, when the bodhisattva great beings give away their nails and fingers out of a desire for the Dharma, they dedicate the goodness so that all sentient beings will have the adornments of the bodies and fingers of all the buddhas.

original: thogs pa med pa'i stobs kyi mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o ////
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i stobs kyi mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o ////
translated: I dedicate so that they may attain the perfection of the power of unobstructed speed.🔽

original: bam po sum cu brgyad pa /
analyzed: bam po sum cu brgyad pa /
translated: I dedicate [this virtue] so that they may attain the perfection of the power of unobstructedness.

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos kyi don du chos tshol ba lhur len pa shin tu dkon pa'i chos tshel  ba la zhugs pa la chos ston pa'i gang zag la las me'i rlubs su lus gzhug par byas te 'di skad du
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos kyi don du chos tshol ba lhur len pa shin tu dkon pa'i chos tshel  ba la zhugs pa la chos ston pa'i gang zag la las me'i rlubs su lus gzhug par byas te 'di skad du
translated: Moreover, when a bodhisattva-mahāsattva is diligently seeking the Dharma for the sake of the Dharma, and has entered the practice of seeking the very rare Dharma, if a person teaching the Dharma were to make him enter a pit of fire, saying:

original: / gal te khyod mi 'greng bdun du brkos pa'i me'i rlubs su mchong phod na /
analyzed: / gal te khyod mi 'greng bdun du brkos pa'i me'i rlubs su mchong phod na /
translated: If you can jump into this pit of fire dug seven human heights deep,

original: ngas khyod la chos kyi sbyin pa bya'o //
analyzed: ngas khyod la chos kyi sbyin pa bya'o //
translated: I will give you the gift of the Dharma,

original: zhe na / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sgra de thos nas shin tu dga' zhing yid bde ba dang / rab tu 'dun pa'i yid skyes nas 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: zhe na / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sgra de thos nas shin tu dga' zhing yid bde ba dang / rab tu 'dun pa'i yid skyes nas 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: then the bodhisattva-mahāsattva, having heard that sound, would be overjoyed, delighted, and his mind would be filled with eagerness. He would think like this:

original: ngan song thams cad dang / mnar med pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su blangs pa dang yang bsngo zhing bdag gis dam pa'i chos @282b btsal dgos na /
analyzed: ngan song thams cad dang / mnar med pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su blangs pa dang yang bsngo zhing bdag gis dam pa'i chos @282b btsal dgos na /
translated: I will also dedicate the experience of all the lower realms and the suffering of the Avīci hell. If I must seek the sublime Dharma,

original: 'di ltar me'i rlubs su mchod pa tsam gyis dam pa'i chos rnyed par 'gyur na lta kye ma de ltar dkon pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag kyang sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal lta bu med par me'i rlubs tsam du mchong bas rnyed pa 'di ni /🔽ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar me'i rlubs su mchod pa tsam gyis dam pa'i chos rnyed par 'gyur na lta kye ma de ltar dkon pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag kyang sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal lta bu med par me'i rlubs tsam du mchong bas rnyed pa 'di ni / ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: then, alas, if I can find the sublime Dharma by merely jumping into a pit of fire, how amazing it is that those rare teachings of the Buddha can be found by jumping into a pit of fire without the suffering of the hells!🔽Thinking thus, I will jump into a pit of fire seven human heights deep. Please explain the Dharma to me, O Buddha.”

original: snyam nas 'di ltar bdag gis mi 'greng bdun du brkos pa'i me'i rlubs su mchong bar bgyi'i; khyod kyis bdag la sangs rgyas kyi chos bshad du gsol zhes nas de ji ltar rgyal po legs par bshad pa tshol ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje sems dpa' dang /
analyzed: snyam nas 'di ltar bdag gis mi 'greng bdun du brkos pa'i me'i rlubs su mchong bar bgyi'i; khyod kyis bdag la sangs rgyas kyi chos bshad du gsol zhes nas de ji ltar rgyal po legs par bshad pa tshol ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje sems dpa' dang /
translated: Then, just as King Sudarśana sought the good explanation and the bodhisattva Vajrasattva,

original: de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan grangs med pa dag gis kyang me'i rlubs su mchod par byas pa de ltar chos kyi don du sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba thams cad dang bsdo ba'i lus kyis me'i rlubs su mchong ba'i tshe dge
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan grangs med pa dag gis kyang me'i rlubs su mchod par byas pa de ltar chos kyi don du sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba thams cad dang bsdo ba'i lus kyis me'i rlubs su mchong ba'i tshe dge
translated: In that way, for the sake of the Dharma, they jumped into the fire pit with bodies that were ready to endure all the feelings of suffering.

original: ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: At that time, they dedicated those roots of virtue to all sentient beings in the following way:

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las shin tu phyir mi ldog pa'i chos can du gyur te thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnas dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las shin tu phyir mi ldog pa'i chos can du gyur te thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnas dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: ‘Through these roots of virtue, may all sentient beings become irreversible from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening and possess the state of omniscience.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi bde ba thams cad myong bar gyur te g-yang sa thams cad las phyir log par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi bde ba thams cad myong bar gyur te g-yang sa thams cad las phyir log par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings experience all the happiness of the buddhas and turn away from all abysses.

original: sems can thams cad 'jigs shing skrag pa thams cad dang @283a *//
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'jigs shing skrag pa thams cad dang @283a *//
translated: May all sentient beings turn away from all fear and terror.

original: bral zhing bag tsha ba med pa'i sems dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: bral zhing bag tsha ba med pa'i sems dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May they be free of anxiety and have a carefree mind.

original: sems can thams cad bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / chos thams cad kyi rgyan rab tu thob cing tshol ba la brtson par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / chos thams cad kyi rgyan rab tu thob cing tshol ba la brtson par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings attain and seek the ornaments of all happiness and mental ease.

original: sems can thams cad me gsum rab tu zhi bas gnas pa'i sems dang ldan zhing ngan song gi lam thams cad dang shin tu bral bar gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad me gsum rab tu zhi bas gnas pa'i sems dang ldan zhing ngan song gi lam thams cad dang shin tu bral bar gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have a mind that abides in the pacification of the three fires and be completely free from all the paths of the lower realms.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi bde ba'i rnam pa rab tu thob ste yid bde ba thams cad dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi bde ba'i rnam pa rab tu thob ste yid bde ba thams cad dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings attain the aspects of the happiness of the buddhas and have all mental ease.

original: sems can thams cad me gsum dang bral zhing byang chub kyi sems kyis 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug zhi bar gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad me gsum dang bral zhing byang chub kyi sems kyis 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug zhi bar gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings be free from the three fires and have the bodhicitta that pacifies desire, anger, and ignorance.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad mthong ba'i dga' bas yang dag par spyod cing byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba rab tu thob par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad mthong ba'i dga' bas yang dag par spyod cing byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba rab tu thob par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings experience the bliss of the bodhisattva samādhi, and may they delight in seeing all sentient beings as buddhas.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mnyam pa med pa la rab tu gzhol zhing shin tu thos pa'i chos can du gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mnyam pa med pa la rab tu gzhol zhing shin tu thos pa'i chos can du gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings be endowed with the Dharma of listening to the unequaled Dharma of all buddhas.🔽May all sentient beings attain the bliss of the bodhisattva’s super-knowledge and play, and may they be endowed with the Dharma that is in accord with omniscience.”

original: sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rjes su shin tu song ba'i chos dang ldan zhing byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pas rnam par rol pa'i bde ba rab tu thob par gyur cig ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po
analyzed: sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rjes su shin tu song ba'i chos dang ldan zhing byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pas rnam par rol pa'i bde ba rab tu thob par gyur cig ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva

original: chos tshol zhing me'i rlubs su mchong pas yang dag par bzung @283b ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyis sgrib pa'i las dang spyod pa'i mthar phyin cing /
analyzed: chos tshol zhing me'i rlubs su mchong pas yang dag par bzung @283b ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyis sgrib pa'i las dang spyod pa'i mthar phyin cing /
translated: should dedicate the roots of virtue that he has gathered by searching for the Dharma and jumping into the fire pit so that all sentient beings may complete their karmic actions and conduct without obscuration.

original: ye shes kyi me shin tu rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi me shin tu rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: I dedicate so that the fire of wisdom may be perfected.

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dam pa'i chos kyi phyir sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba thams cad bdag gi lus kyis bzod par byed cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dam pa'i chos kyi phyir sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba thams cad bdag gi lus kyis bzod par byed cing /
translated: “Moreover, when great bodhisattva beings, for the sake of the sacred doctrine, endure all the feelings of suffering with their bodies,

original: dam pa'i chos brjod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam ston pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi byang chub gsal bar byed pa dang / bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi phung po'i tshogs yang dag par gsog pa dang / stobs bcu la brtson par byed cing thams cad mkhyen par sems bskyed pa yangs par byed pa dang /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos brjod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam ston pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi byang chub gsal bar byed pa dang / bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi phung po'i tshogs yang dag par gsog pa dang / stobs bcu la brtson par byed cing thams cad mkhyen par sems bskyed pa yangs par byed pa dang /
translated: they proclaim the sacred doctrine, reveal the path of the bodhisattvas, illuminate the enlightenment of the buddhas, gather the accumulations of the unsurpassed aggregates of wisdom, strive for the ten powers, and expand the mind of omniscience.

original: chags pa med pa'i ye shes kyi phung po la bdag mngon du mthun par yang dag par lta zhing sems can thams cad kyi rnam par dag pa dang / rnam par byang ba yang dag par sgrub pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul thams cad la rab tu 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i ye shes kyi phung po la bdag mngon du mthun par yang dag par lta zhing sems can thams cad kyi rnam par dag pa dang / rnam par byang ba yang dag par sgrub pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul thams cad la rab tu 'jug pa dang /
translated: He saw the aggregate of wisdom free from attachment as the self, and he correctly saw the purification and complete purification of all sentient beings. He engaged in all the bodhisattva activities.

original: ye shes chen po la brtson zhing sangs rgyas kyi byang chub yongs su srung ba'i tshe ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos bzang po tshol ba dang / rgyal po shugs chen po 'dzin pa dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan tshad med pa dag gis kyang ji ltar spyad pa bzhin du de sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa gcig ma yin pa nyams su 'bab pa dang /
analyzed: ye shes chen po la brtson zhing sangs rgyas kyi byang chub yongs su srung ba'i tshe ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos bzang po tshol ba dang / rgyal po shugs chen po 'dzin pa dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan tshad med pa dag gis kyang ji ltar spyad pa bzhin du de sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa gcig ma yin pa nyams su 'bab pa dang /
translated: He was diligent in great wisdom and protected the enlightenment of the buddhas. At that time, just as the bodhisattva Good Dharma, the bodhisattva King of Great Strength, and countless other bodhisattvas had practiced, he experienced the various kinds of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i gnod pa rnam pa @284a *//

translated: “They dedicate those roots of virtue in this way: ‘Through these roots of virtue, may all sentient beings

analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad mnyes par byas te mi mnyes par mi byed pa dang / sangs rgyas blta ba dang mi 'bral bar gyur cig /
translated: please all the buddhas and not displease them, and may they never be separated from seeing the Buddha.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad blta ba yid la bya ba dang ma bral zhing sangs rgyas blta bar brtson pa'i yid dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad blta ba yid la bya ba dang ma bral zhing sangs rgyas blta bar brtson pa'i yid dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings never be separated from keeping in mind the sight of all the buddhas and may they have minds that are intent on seeing the Buddha.’

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi gsung dang chos kyi mdzod yang dag par 'dzin cing ye shes sgom pa shin tu mang bar gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi gsung dang chos kyi mdzod yang dag par 'dzin cing ye shes sgom pa shin tu mang bar gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings hold the speech of the buddhas and the treasury of the Dharma, and may they cultivate wisdom.

original: sems can thams cad chos mnyan pa dang mi 'bral zhing bskal pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la yang dag par gnas pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sgra 'byin par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad chos mnyan pa dang mi 'bral zhing bskal pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la yang dag par gnas pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sgra 'byin par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings be endowed with the Dharma, and may they be able to proclaim the Dharma of the buddhas for all kalpas, in order to remain in the bodhisattva way of life.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas 'byung ba mthong zhing ye shes yang dag par gzung ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag par gyur cig /🔽sems can thams cad sangs rgyas yid la bya ba dang / mthong bar @291a *//
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas 'byung ba mthong zhing ye shes yang dag par gzung ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag par gyur cig / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas yid la bya ba dang / mthong bar @291a *//
translated: May all sentient beings be endowed with the applications of mindfulness, and may they see the buddhas and hold the wisdom.

original: bya ba'i mthu la brtson zhing yid la bya ba las gzhan med par gyur cig /
analyzed: bya ba'i mthu la brtson zhing yid la bya ba las gzhan med par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings be endowed with the power of mindfulness of the buddhas and the power of seeing the buddhas, and may they be without any other thoughts.

original: sems can thams cad nam mkha'i dbyings kun tu sangs rgyas mthong ba'i 'byung gnas la zhugs shing phyogs kun tu sangs rgyas mthong ba rab tu thob par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad nam mkha'i dbyings kun tu sangs rgyas mthong ba'i 'byung gnas la zhugs shing phyogs kun tu sangs rgyas mthong ba rab tu thob par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings enter the realm of space, the source of seeing the Buddha, and may they attain the vision of the Buddha in all directions.

original: sems can thams cad 'jig rten gyi khams kun tu sangs rgyas byung ba brjod pa la brtson zhing sangs rgyas kyi skus byin gyis brlabs par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'jig rten gyi khams kun tu sangs rgyas byung ba brjod pa la brtson zhing sangs rgyas kyi skus byin gyis brlabs par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings be intent on proclaiming the appearance of the Buddha in all worlds, and may they be blessed by the body of the Buddha.

original: sems can thams cad mos pa dang / dad pa mi shigs pa dang / snying thag pa'i bsam pas sangs rgyas thams cad 'grogs par gyur te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad mos pa dang / dad pa mi shigs pa dang / snying thag pa'i bsam pas sangs rgyas thams cad 'grogs par gyur te /
translated: May all sentient beings be accompanied by all the buddhas with indestructible faith and devotion and with the deepest aspirations,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos rdzogs par thos par byas par gyur cig /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos rdzogs par thos par byas par gyur cig /
translated: and may they listen to the perfect Dharma of the buddhas through the spiritual friend.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas skye ba don yod pas 'gro ba thams cad rnam par sbyang ba'i phyir sangs rgyas skye ba thams cad rab tu brjod par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas skye ba don yod pas 'gro ba thams cad rnam par sbyang ba'i phyir sangs rgyas skye ba thams cad rab tu brjod par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings proclaim all the births of the buddhas in order to purify all beings through the birth of the buddhas.

original: ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas skye ba brjod pas yang dag par gzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas mthong ba dang / mnyes par byed pa dang / mi mnyes par mi byed cing /
analyzed: ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas skye ba brjod pas yang dag par gzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas mthong ba dang / mnyes par byed pa dang / mi mnyes par mi byed cing /
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva dedicates those roots of virtue that he has gathered by praising the buddhas’ births so that all sentient beings may see the buddhas, please them, not displease them,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos bla na med pa thams cad yongs su dag pa'i mthar phyin par yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos bla na med pa thams cad yongs su dag pa'i mthar phyin par yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: and perfect the attainment of all the unsurpassed qualities of the buddhas.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ci dga' ba'i longs spyod dam /

analyzed: 'phags pa'i dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi longs spyod dam /
translated: the enjoyments of the temples of the noble saṅgha,

analyzed: pha ma gnas pa'i gnas sam /

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas sam /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas sam /

analyzed: gang zag gi rnam pa spyin pa'i gnas dag gam /

analyzed: de ma yin pa'i phongs pa dang / bkren pa slong zhing len pa dag gam /

analyzed: yo byad sna tshogs gzhag pa'i gnas ci 'dod pa'i longs spyod du bya ba'am /

analyzed: 'jigs pa dang dogs pa med cing dgra dang bral ba /

original: skyi g-ya' ba med pa'i gnas kyi sa dag 'bul ba'i tshe sa'i sbyin pa yongs su btang bas yul ci 'dod par byin bas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
