original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob cing thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa yongs su dag par gyur cig /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob cing thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa yongs su dag par gyur cig /
translated: By this root of virtue, may all sentient beings attain the perfection of the bodhisattva Samantabhadra’s conduct and attain the completely pure level of omniscience.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par 'dzin pa la dran pa'i dbang po rmongs pa med cing sa lta bur red @292a *//🔽par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par 'dzin pa la dran pa'i dbang po rmongs pa med cing sa lta bur red @292a *// par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings be free of confusion in the faculty of memory in upholding all the teachings of the Buddha and be like the earth.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa thams cad srung ba la zhugs shing yang dag par 'dzin par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa thams cad srung ba la zhugs shing yang dag par 'dzin par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings uphold and protect all the teachings of the Buddha.

original: sems can thams cad 'gro ba thams cad la zhe sdang ba med cing dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par sbyang ba la brtson pas sems sa dang mnyam par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'gro ba thams cad la zhe sdang ba med cing dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par sbyang ba la brtson pas sems sa dang mnyam par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings be like the earth in their minds, free of anger toward all beings and striving to purify the roots of virtue.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad yang dag par sgrub pa la mkhas shing sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rigs yang dag par 'dzin pa la zhugs par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad yang dag par sgrub pa la mkhas shing sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rigs yang dag par 'dzin pa la zhugs par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings be skilled in accomplishing all the bodhisattva levels in all the lineages of the buddhas, one after another, and may they enter into the holding of the lineage of all the buddhas.

original: sems can thams cad 'gro ba kun yongs su smin par bya ba dang / 'dul ba rnam par dag pa'i lam la zhugs te gnas su red par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'gro ba kun yongs su smin par bya ba dang / 'dul ba rnam par dag pa'i lam la zhugs te gnas su red par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings enter the path of purifying the ripening and training of all migrating beings and may they become the resting place of all migrating beings.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi stobs la rab tu dgod par brtson zhing sangs rgyas lta bur 'gro ba thams cad la phan 'dogs par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi stobs la rab tu dgod par brtson zhing sangs rgyas lta bur 'gro ba thams cad la phan 'dogs par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings strive to establish all migrating beings in the power of the buddhas and may they benefit all migrating beings like the buddhas.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi dga' ba bla na med pa la rab tu gzhog pa'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad kyi dga' bar red par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi dga' ba bla na med pa la rab tu gzhog pa'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad kyi dga' bar red par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings become the resting place of the joy of all migrating beings, in order to establish all migrating beings in the unsurpassed joy of the buddhas.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa'i chos kyi 'byung gnas su gyur te rab tu dgod pa la mkhas par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa'i chos kyi 'byung gnas su gyur te rab tu dgod pa la mkhas par gyur cig /
translated: May they become skilled in establishing all sentient beings in the source of the Dharma of the powers and fearlessnesses of the Buddhas.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyis rnam par rtse zhing yongs su spyod pa @292b thob ste sa lta bu'i ye shes dang ldan par gyur cig /🔽ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sa'i sbyin pa yongs su btang bas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ci nas kyang sems can gyi khams thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa yongs su dag pa thams cad rab
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyis rnam par rtse zhing yongs su spyod pa @292b thob ste sa lta bu'i ye shes dang ldan par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sa'i sbyin pa yongs su btang bas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ci nas kyang sems can gyi khams thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa yongs su dag pa thams cad rab
translated: May all sentient beings attain the wisdom of the level of the earth, and enjoy and play with the Dharma of all the Buddhas.

original: tu thob par bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: tu thob par bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva, by giving away the earth, dedicates those roots of goodness to all sentient beings so that the entire realm of sentient beings may attain the completely pure level of the Tathāgatas.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byung ba rnams la rim 'gro'i don du bdag gi bran dang / las byed pa rnams 'bul ba'am; byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par spel ba'i brtson pa rnams sam /

translated: They offer to the bodhisattvas, the spiritual friends who are dedicated to increasing all the qualities of the buddhas,🔽the precious saṅgha of noble ones, and to their parents, teachers, and gurus, their servants and workers.

original: 'phags pa'i dge 'dun dkon mchog gam; pha dang / ma dang / slob dpon dang / bla ma'i sbyin pa'i gnas la bran dang / las byed pa'i mi 'bul ba dang / sems can nad pa rnams la rim gro byed pa med pas 'chi bar mi 'gyur bar rim gro bya ba'i phyir bran dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i dge 'dun dkon mchog gam; pha dang / ma dang / slob dpon dang / bla ma'i sbyin pa'i gnas la bran dang / las byed pa'i mi 'bul ba dang / sems can nad pa rnams la rim gro byed pa med pas 'chi bar mi 'gyur bar rim gro bya ba'i phyir bran dang /
translated: They give servants and workers to sentient beings who are sick, in order to care for them and prevent their death.

original: las byed pa'i mi sbyin pa'am /
analyzed: las byed pa'i mi sbyin pa'am /
translated: They give servants and workers

original: de ma yin pa'i sems can g-yog med pa la bran dang / las byed pa'i mi gtong ba'am /
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i sems can g-yog med pa la bran dang / las byed pa'i mi gtong ba'am /
translated: to sentient beings who have no attendants.

original: phongs pa dang bkren pa slong zhing len pa gzhan dang gzhan dag la bran dang / las byed pa'i mi gtong ba'am /
analyzed: phongs pa dang bkren pa slong zhing len pa gzhan dang gzhan dag la bran dang / las byed pa'i mi gtong ba'am /
translated: They give away and send out to others servants and workers who are poor and destitute and who come begging.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mchod rten @293a *//🔽bsrung ba'i phyir 'bul ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mchod rten @293a *// bsrung ba'i phyir 'bul ba'am /

original: sems can thams cad yid la bya ba dang / bsam pa dang / rnam par rtog pa gzhan med cing sangs rgyas thams cad la rtag tu skabs phye bar gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yid la bya ba dang / bsam pa dang / rnam par rtog pa gzhan med cing sangs rgyas thams cad la rtag tu skabs phye bar gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have no other thoughts, intentions, or ideas, and may they always be available to all the buddhas.

original: sems can thams cad dge ba thams cad yang dag par sdud pa la brtson zhing sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rigs las mi nyams pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rjes su snyegs par gyur cig /

original: sems can thams cad don yod par dus thams cad du 'phrad cing sangs rgyas thams cad la dus dang mthun par rim gro dang bsnyen bkur byed par gyur cig /

analyzed: sems can thams cad yi ge rnam par dag pas mi 'jigs par spyod cing sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi don 'dzin par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings be fearless through the purity of letters and hold the meaning of the Buddha’s teachings.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas la lus dang srog phul zhing sangs rgyas thams cad la ngom mi shes par lta bar gyur cig /

translated: May all sentient beings be insatiable in their desire to see all the buddhas and offer them their bodies and lives.

original: sems can thams cad 'jig rten gyi gnas thams cad yang dag par 'joms pas sangs rgyas thams cad la lta ba dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'jig rten gyi gnas thams cad yang dag par 'joms pas sangs rgyas thams cad la lta ba dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings be endowed with the vision of all the buddhas through the destruction of all worldly abodes.

original: sems can thams cad ngo mtshar du 'dzin pa dang / de ma yin pa'i gnas gzhan med cing sangs rgyas thams cad la brten par 'gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ngo mtshar du 'dzin pa dang / de ma yin pa'i gnas gzhan med cing sangs rgyas thams cad la brten par 'gyur cig /

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos bla na med pa @294a *//

original: sems can de dag thams cad dge ba'i rtsa ba des mchod rten gyi dam par 'gyur ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad bsnyen bkur bar 'os par 'gyur ba dang / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi ye shes rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i gnas dam par 'gyur ba dang /

translated: By means of those roots of virtue, may all those sentient beings become the highest of shrines, worthy of being venerated by all beings, and become the highest recipients of offerings, so that all sentient beings may realize the wisdom of the buddhas.

original: 'gro ba thams cad la snying brtse ba'i phyir len pa'i dam par 'gyur ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la 'jug pa'i phyir bsod nams kyi don dam pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / sbyin pa tshad med pa'i phyir sbyin sreg dam pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang /

translated: They dedicate so that they may be the best of those who take up the practice of generosity, out of love for all beings; so that they may have the highest merit, by engaging in all the roots of virtue; so that they may have the highest burnt offerings, by means of their immeasurable generosity;

original: khams gsum thams cad na 'byung ba'i dam par 'gyur ba dang / lam ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ded dpon dam par 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang @295b dag par bzung ba'i phyir gzungs kyi dam pa rab tu thob par 'gyur ba dang /

translated: so that they may be the highest in all the three worlds; so that they may be the best of guides, by teaching the path as it is; so that they may attain the highest dhāraṇī, by upholding all the qualities of the buddhas;

original: nam mkha'i dbyings ltar chags pa med pa'i lam gyi 'byung bas chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa dam par 'gyur ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ste /

translated: and so that they may be the highest of the limitless dharmadhātu, by being the source of the path that is free of attachment like the expanse of space.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag rim gro par phul bas /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag rim gro par phul bas /

original: yang dag par gzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can gyi khams thams cad phyag bya bar 'os pa'i ye shes kyi phung po dang ldan par bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo'o //

analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos la dga' ba dang / dad pa dang / rab tu dga' zhing dang ba'i sems kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la chos dkon mchog bla na med pa la mos pa'i bsam pa dang /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva, with a mind of joy, faith, and delight in the Dharma, to the Blessed Buddhas, with the intention of aspiring to the unsurpassed jewel of the Dharma,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad la phar sems pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / chos bye ba grangs med par tshad med pa'i chos kyi khong du chud cing yang dag par bzung ba dang / shes rab chen po rin po che la yang dag par gzhol ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon du gyur pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad la phar sems pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / chos bye ba grangs med par tshad med pa'i chos kyi khong du chud cing yang dag par bzung ba dang / shes rab chen po rin po che la yang dag par gzhol ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon du gyur pa dang /
translated: It is to have the intention to generate the mind of awakening toward all buddhas, to comprehend and uphold the immeasurable Dharma of the countless Dharma gates, and to manifest the roots of virtue that are dedicated to the great jewel of insight.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa mtha' yas pa rjes su dran pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yul dang / don gyi rjes su 'brang bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ldem po dag khong du chud pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sprin las sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi char mngon par bab pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa mtha' yas pa rjes su dran pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yul dang / don gyi rjes su 'brang bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ldem po dag khong du chud pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sprin las sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi char mngon par bab pa dang /
translated: It is to remember the infinite conduct of the thus-gone ones, to comprehend the domain of the buddhas and the indirect teachings of the thus-gone ones by following their meaning, and to receive the rain of Dharma of all buddhas from the Dharma clouds of the thus-gone ones.

original: @296a *// rtul phod pas dbang bsgyur ba sems kyi dpa' bas thob pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i theg pa phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa gang zag gi mchog gi sar shin tu bstan pa dang / chos chen po bye ba brgya stong tshad med pas shin tu brtan pa'i dbang pos bdag gi lus 'bul zhing de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos de lta bu dag nyan pas /
analyzed: @296a *// rtul phod pas dbang bsgyur ba sems kyi dpa' bas thob pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i theg pa phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa gang zag gi mchog gi sar shin tu bstan pa dang / chos chen po bye ba brgya stong tshad med pas shin tu brtan pa'i dbang pos bdag gi lus 'bul zhing de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos de lta bu dag nyan pas /
translated: In that way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who listens to such Dharmas

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la dga' ba tshad med pa rnam par 'phel ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la dga' ba tshad med pa rnam par 'phel ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: has a mind that increases immeasurable faith in the Tathāgata.🔽He is a holy being who is established in the practice of the Dharma.

original: chos spyod pa la yang dag par gnas pa'i sems can dam pa rang gi the tshom chod pa /
analyzed: chos spyod pa la yang dag par gnas pa'i sems can dam pa rang gi the tshom chod pa /
translated: He has cut through his own doubts

original: gzhan gyi the tshom gcod pa la rab tu zhugs pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyi the tshom gcod pa la rab tu zhugs pa /
translated: and has engaged in cutting through the doubts of others.

original: rab tu dag pa'i mtshan mas sems ma nyams pa /
analyzed: rab tu dag pa'i mtshan mas sems ma nyams pa /
translated: He has a mind that is not corrupted by the signs of purity.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dang / yon tan gyi 'byung gnas rab tu thob pa /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dang / yon tan gyi 'byung gnas rab tu thob pa /
translated: He has attained the source of all roots of merit and qualities.

original: bsam pa tshad med pa'i spyod pa'i rjes su zhugs pa /
analyzed: bsam pa tshad med pa'i spyod pa'i rjes su zhugs pa /
translated: they were engaged in the conduct of immeasurable thoughts;

original: sems can thams cad kyi don la brtson pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don la brtson pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: they had minds that were dedicated to the benefit of all sentient beings;

original: rdo rje'i snying po lta bu'i ye shes dam pa'i khyad par khong du chud pa'i sems brtan cing shin tu gnas pa /
analyzed: rdo rje'i snying po lta bu'i ye shes dam pa'i khyad par khong du chud pa'i sems brtan cing shin tu gnas pa /
translated: their minds were firm and stable, having realized the sacred wisdom that is like the essence of a vajra;

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhabs kyi drung na gnas shing rnam par dag par byed pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhabs kyi drung na gnas shing rnam par dag par byed pa /
translated: they were present at the feet of all buddhas and were purifying;🔽they were never separated from being present at the feet of all tathāgatas;

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhabs kyi drung na gnas pa las mi 'bral ba de chos kyi rnam pa 'di lta bu dag la rab tu gnas te rang gi lus de bzhin @296b gshegs pa la mngon par 'bul ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhabs kyi drung na gnas pa las mi 'bral ba de chos kyi rnam pa 'di lta bu dag la rab tu gnas te rang gi lus de bzhin @296b gshegs pa la mngon par 'bul ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag
translated: they were established in these kinds of qualities, and when they offered their own bodies to the tathāgatas, they dedicated those roots of virtue

original: sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: in this way for the sake of all sentient beings:

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yang dag par bzung ba'i lus dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yang dag par bzung ba'i lus dang ldan zhing /
translated: “Through these roots of virtue, may all sentient beings have bodies that are accepted by all buddhas.

original: mi dma' ba'i lus yongs su rdzogs pa rab tu thob par gyur cig /
analyzed: mi dma' ba'i lus yongs su rdzogs pa rab tu thob par gyur cig /
translated: May they attain a body that is not inferior and is complete.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad blta ba dang mi 'bral ba'i rjes su song ba'i sems dang ldan pas sangs rgyas thams cad la nye bar brten cing spyod par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad blta ba dang mi 'bral ba'i rjes su song ba'i sems dang ldan pas sangs rgyas thams cad la nye bar brten cing spyod par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have a mind that is in accord with never being apart from seeing all the buddhas, and may they rely on and practice in the presence of all the buddhas.

original: sems can thams cad ye shes kyi yon tan dang ldan zhing nyams pa med pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ye shes kyi yon tan dang ldan zhing nyams pa med pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have a body that is endowed with the qualities of wisdom and is not impaired.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad mnyes par bya ba la brtson zhing mi dmigs pas tshangs pa'i spyad pa spyod par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad mnyes par bya ba la brtson zhing mi dmigs pas tshangs pa'i spyad pa spyod par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings practice pure conduct by being diligent in pleasing all the buddhas and by being free of reference points.

original: sems can thams cad bdag tu bya ba dang / bdag gir bya ba las gyen du 'phags shing bdag gi med pa'i lus rab tu thob par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad bdag tu bya ba dang / bdag gir bya ba las gyen du 'phags shing bdag gi med pa'i lus rab tu thob par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings attain a body that is free of self and mine and is exalted above self and mine.

original: sems can thams cad lus 'phos pa med par lus yang dag par ston cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du lus rnam par bkram par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad lus 'phos pa med par lus yang dag par ston cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du lus rnam par bkram par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings display their bodies without having to change their bodies and may their bodies pervade all buddha-fields.

original: sems can thams cad bdag gi med cing yongs su 'dzin pa med par 'gro bas gzhan la rag las pa med pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad bdag gi med cing yongs su 'dzin pa med par 'gro bas gzhan la rag las pa med pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have bodies that are not dependent on others, going without a self and without grasping.

original: sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i rgyud kyi rigs dang ldan zhing sangs rgyas kyi skur @297a *//🔽mngon par skyes par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i rgyud kyi rigs dang ldan zhing sangs rgyas kyi skur @297a *// mngon par skyes par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have the body of a buddha, born from the lineage of the unsurpassed vehicle.🔽May all sentient beings have bodies that are without equal, with bodies that are the completely perfected, pure bodies of the Tathagata.

original: sems can thams cad bzod pa'i stobs kyis sems la thub pa med cing chos kyi stobs dang ldan pa'i lus can du gyur cig /🔽sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnam par dag pa yongs su rdzogs pas 'dra ba med pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad bzod pa'i stobs kyis sems la thub pa med cing chos kyi stobs dang ldan pa'i lus can du gyur cig /🔽sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnam par dag pa yongs su rdzogs pas 'dra ba med pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have bodies that are powerful with the power of Dharma, their minds unassailable through the power of patience.

original: sems can thams cad dmigs pa med pa'i dbyings su byung bas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsod nams kyi lus dang ldan par gyur cig /🔽ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa la rang gi lus phul bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ci nas kyang sems can gyi khams thams cad dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang rgyud
analyzed: sems can thams cad dmigs pa med pa'i dbyings su byung bas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsod nams kyi lus dang ldan par gyur cig / ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa la rang gi lus phul bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ci nas kyang sems can gyi khams thams cad dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang rgyud
translated: May all sentient beings have the body of supramundane merit, since they arise in the basic space that is free of reference points.

original: du yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: du yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: In this way, bodhisattva great beings dedicate to all sentient beings the roots of virtue that are subsumed by their offering of their own bodies to the thus-gone ones, so that the family and lineage of the thus-gone ones of the three times may be perfectly accomplished in the realms of all sentient beings.

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad la 'gro ba kun gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba ltar phan 'dogs pas bdag nyid yongs su gtong ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba la yang dag par sems pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad la 'gro ba kun gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba ltar phan 'dogs pas bdag nyid yongs su gtong ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba la yang dag par sems pa dang /
translated: In this way, bodhisattva great beings give themselves to all sentient beings, benefiting them like the roots of virtue of all migrating beings. They think of the roots of virtue of all sentient beings.

original: mar me lta bur bdag sems can rnams la bsnyen pa dang / bde ba lta bur bdag sems can thams cad la byin gyis rlob pa dang / chos kyi gzhi lta bur @297b bdag 'gro ba thams cad yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / snang ba lta bur bdag sems can thams cad la yongs su gtong ba dang /
analyzed: mar me lta bur bdag sems can rnams la bsnyen pa dang / bde ba lta bur bdag sems can thams cad la byin gyis rlob pa dang / chos kyi gzhi lta bur @297b bdag 'gro ba thams cad yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / snang ba lta bur bdag sems can thams cad la yongs su gtong ba dang /
translated: Like light, I will give myself to all sentient beings.🔽Like a mirage, I will appear to all sentient beings.🔽Like a cause for roots of virtue, I will show myself to all beings.

original: 'gro ba thams cad mig yor lta bur bdag sems can thams cad la snang bar byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu lta bur bdag 'gro ba thams cad la ston pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen lta bur bdag sems can thams cad la stob pa dang /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad mig yor lta bur bdag sems can thams cad la snang bar byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu lta bur bdag 'gro ba thams cad la ston pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen lta bur bdag sems can thams cad la stob pa dang /
translated: Like a spiritual friend, I will serve all sentient beings.

original: lam lta bur bdag sems can thams cad la yang dag par ston pa dang / bla na med pa'i bde ba'i rnam pa rab tu thob pa lta bur bdag sems can thams cad la yongs su sbyong ba dang / nyi ma lta bur bdag 'gro ba thams cad la snyoms pa byed pa dang /
analyzed: lam lta bur bdag sems can thams cad la yang dag par ston pa dang / bla na med pa'i bde ba'i rnam pa rab tu thob pa lta bur bdag sems can thams cad la yongs su sbyong ba dang / nyi ma lta bur bdag 'gro ba thams cad la snyoms pa byed pa dang /
translated: Just as the sun is impartial to all beings, I will be impartial to all beings.

original: de lta bu'i chos dang ldan par bdag sems can thams cad la yongs su gtong ba'i tshe bdag btang bas byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos dang ldan par bdag sems can thams cad la yongs su gtong ba'i tshe bdag btang bas byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: When I give myself to all sentient beings in this way, endowed with such qualities, I will dedicate the roots of virtue that arise from giving myself to all sentient beings in the following way:

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi sar rab tu phyin par gyur cig /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi sar rab tu phyin par gyur cig /
translated: “By these roots of virtue, may all sentient beings reach the ground of the wisdom of the buddhas.

original: sems can thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings possess the wisdom of unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.”

original: sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du dul ba thob par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du dul ba thob par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings be disciplined in the circle of the Tathagata’s retinue.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi phyir spyod pa mkhas shing spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par @298a *//
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi phyir spyod pa mkhas shing spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par @298a *//
translated: May all sentient beings be skilled in the practice of the Buddha’s conduct and be endowed with the perfection of conduct.

original: gyur cig / sems can thams cad don dang / chos dang / ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa dang ldan zhing mya ngan las 'da' ba'i mthu yod par gyur cig /
analyzed: gyur cig / sems can thams cad don dang / chos dang / ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa dang ldan zhing mya ngan las 'da' ba'i mthu yod par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have the power of nirvana, endowed with the wisdom and superknowledges of the Dharma and its meaning.

original: sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung bas rab tu tshim par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung bas rab tu tshim par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings be satisfied by the arising of the Tathagata’s lineage.

original: sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa dge bas ma rig pa'i bsam pa spang bar gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa dge bas ma rig pa'i bsam pa spang bar gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings abandon the attitude of ignorance through the virtuous intention of the Tathagata.

original: sems can thams cad byang chub kyi shing drung du dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan pas shin tu byung bar gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad byang chub kyi shing drung du dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan pas shin tu byung bar gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings be endowed with roots of virtue and be seated at the foot of the Bodhi tree.

original: sems can thams cad 'tshe ba'i sems bskyed pa dang bral zhing nyon mongs pa'i dgra shin tu choms par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'tshe ba'i sems bskyed pa dang bral zhing nyon mongs pa'i dgra shin tu choms par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings be free from the arising of thoughts of violence and be completely victorious over the enemy of the afflictions.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir yongs su srung ba thob par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir yongs su srung ba thob par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings attain the protection of upholding the teachings of the Buddha.

original: ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad la bdag yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'gro ba thams cad la phan pa dang / sems can thams cad kyis bla na med pa'i bde ba dang ldan pa thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad la bdag yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'gro ba thams cad la phan pa dang / sems can thams cad kyis bla na med pa'i bde ba dang ldan pa thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, having gathered the roots of virtue by completely giving himself to all sentient beings, dedicates them to the benefit of all beings and to the attainment of unsurpassed bliss by all sentient beings.

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas thams cad la drin du gzo ba'i sems bskyed pas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rim gro bya ba dang / bu ltar bsam pa @298b dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byang chub tu lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par sbyang ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas thams cad la drin du gzo ba'i sems bskyed pas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rim gro bya ba dang / bu ltar bsam pa @298b dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byang chub tu lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par sbyang ba dang /
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, through the generation of the mind that repays the kindness of all buddhas, serves all buddhas,🔽has the intention of a son, and purifies the superior intention for the enlightenment of all tathāgatas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la sems 'di snang zhing dang bar byin gyis brlab pa dang / 'jig rten gyi 'du shes las bdag phyir log par bya ba dang / bdag sangs rgyas kyi rigs su gtogs par bgrang ba dang / bdag sangs rgyas thams cad dang mthun par gzung ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la sems 'di snang zhing dang bar byin gyis brlab pa dang / 'jig rten gyi 'du shes las bdag phyir log par bya ba dang / bdag sangs rgyas kyi rigs su gtogs par bgrang ba dang / bdag sangs rgyas thams cad dang mthun par gzung ba dang /
translated: He blesses this mind to be bright and clear with regard to all buddha qualities, turns away from worldly notions, counts himself as belonging to the buddha family, and is upheld in accordance with all buddhas.

original: bdag bdud kyi yul las ring du bya ba dang / bdag sangs rgyas kyi yul la mos par bya ba dang / bdag sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi snod du byin gyis brlab pa dang / de lta bu'i chos la brtson par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas thams cad la rim gro byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: bdag bdud kyi yul las ring du bya ba dang / bdag sangs rgyas kyi yul la mos par bya ba dang / bdag sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi snod du byin gyis brlab pa dang / de lta bu'i chos la brtson par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas thams cad la rim gro byed pa'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: When bodhisattva great beings who are diligent in such qualities serve all the buddhas, they dedicate that root of virtue to all sentient beings in the following way:

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rin po che'i 'byung gnas su gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rin po che'i 'byung gnas su gyur te /
translated: ‘May this root of virtue make all sentient beings a source of the jewel of omniscient wisdom.

original: sems nye bar brtan pa rnam par dag pa rab tu thob par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems nye bar brtan pa rnam par dag pa rab tu thob par gyur cig /
translated: May they attain the pure, stable mind.

original: sems can thams cad sdig to'i las thams cad la zhe sdang zhing cang shes dang yang dag par 'grogs par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sdig to'i las thams cad la zhe sdang zhing cang shes dang yang dag par 'grogs par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings be free from all unwholesome actions and be skilled and well-behaved.’

original: sems can thams cad shin tu bzung ba'i chos can du gyur te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad shin tu bzung ba'i chos can du gyur te /
translated: May all sentient beings be endowed with the Dharma of complete retention.

original: mi byed pa'i g-yog dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: mi byed pa'i g-yog dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings be endowed with the retinue of non-action.

original: sems can thams cad dbang bskur ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa thob ste /🔽de bzhin gshegs @299a *//
analyzed: sems can thams cad dbang bskur ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa thob ste / de bzhin gshegs @299a *//
translated: May all sentient beings attain the bodhisattva level of consecration

original: pa thams cad kyi slob mar gyur cig /
analyzed: pa thams cad kyi slob mar gyur cig /
translated: and become disciples of all the tathagatas.

translated: In such a way do they dedicate those wholesome roots, so that there will be no clinging to the aggregates, elements, and sense-media.

original: ci nas kyang phyi nang gi chos thams cad du lus la gnas pa'i sems mi skye ba de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o //

translated: In such a way do they dedicate those wholesome roots, so that there will be no arising of a mind dwelling on the body in regard to all internal and external things.

original: ci nas kyang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad la rmongs par mi 'gyur ba de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o //

translated: In such a way do they dedicate those wholesome roots, so that they will never be separated from the spiritual benefactors.

translated: In this way, they dedicate those wholesome roots so as to please all spiritual teachers.

original: gzhan yang 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: “Moreover, they dedicate their wholesome roots in the following way:

original: rgyal po'i srid byin pas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad chos kyi dbang phyug gi dam pa thob ste chos kyi rgyal po'i srid la dbang bsgyur ba rab tu thob par gyur cig /

translated: ‘Through the wholesome roots gathered by giving away my kingdom, may all sentient beings attain the supreme sovereignty of the Dharma and become rulers of the Dharma-kingdom.

original: sems can thams cad rgyal po'i dkrug ma dang / dgra thams cad rab tu gzhom pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi rgyal srid rab tu thob par gyur cig /

original: sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos rab tu brjod pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi rgyal srid chen po la rab tu gnas par gyur cig /

translated: May all sentient beings abide in the great kingdom of the Buddha in order to proclaim the Dharma of the Buddha with the wisdom of the Tathāgata.’

original: sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo thogs pa med pa bskor ba'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul gyi rgyal srid la rab tu gzhol bar gyur cig /

translated: May all sentient beings be established in the kingdom of the domain of all the buddhas, in order to turn the unsurpassed, unobstructed wheel of the Dharma.

original: sems can thams cad chos kyi dbang phyug sangs rgyas kyi rigs rgyun mi 'chad par yang dag par 'dzin pa'i tshul du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa bas mngon par byung bar gyur cig /

translated: May all sentient beings be born from the roots of virtue of all the tathagatas, in the manner of upholding the sovereignty of the Dharma and the unbroken lineage of the buddhas.

original: sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa' tshad med pa yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir srid yangs shing /🔽tshad med pa rjes su skyong bar gyur cig /🔽sems can thams cad sangs rgyas 'byung ba rgyun ma chad pa dang ldan zhing chos kyi dbyings la nges pa'i rgyal srid dang ldan @301a *//

translated: May all sentient beings be sustained by the vast and limitless existence of the bodhisattvas.

original: par gyur cig /
analyzed: par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings be endowed with the uninterrupted appearance of the buddhas and the sovereignty of the realm of the Dharma.

original: nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa thams cad du chos kyi sbyin bdag tu gyur cig /
analyzed: nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa thams cad du chos kyi sbyin bdag tu gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings become givers of the gift of Dharma, throughout the whole realm of space and the entire expanse of the world, by means of the method of establishing all the beings of the world in the Great Vehicle.

original: sems can thams cad 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu gyur te ltod pa med pa'i rgyal srid rab tu thob par gyur cig /

translated: May all sentient beings attain the sovereignty of the unsurpassed, being of the same continuum of virtue as all the Buddhas of the past, present, and future.

original: ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rgyal po'i srid yongs su btang bas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ci nas kyang 'gro ba thams cad du shin tu bde ba dang / legs pa 'byung ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rgyal po'i srid yongs su btang bas yang dag par bzung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ci nas kyang 'gro ba thams cad du shin tu bde ba dang / legs pa 'byung ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, by giving up the royal position, dedicates those roots of virtue to all sentient beings so that they may attain the highest happiness and well-being in all their lives.

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems mi 'khrugs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sems rtse gcig pa dang / smon lam tshad med par byas te snying rje chen po bskyed cing byams pa chen po'i stobs nye bar bzhag ste bsam pa shin tu tshim par byas nas sems can gyi don la bdag rab tu bzhag ste ye @301b shes chen po la shin tu mos par byas
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems mi 'khrugs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sems rtse gcig pa dang / smon lam tshad med par byas te snying rje chen po bskyed cing byams pa chen po'i stobs nye bar bzhag ste bsam pa shin tu tshim par byas nas sems can gyi don la bdag rab tu bzhag ste ye @301b shes chen po la shin tu mos par byas

original: nas sangs rgyas kyi chos la mnyam pa'i sems su byas te dge ba'i chos nyid la rnam par dpyod cing thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyal srid la rab tu gzhol bar sems bskyed pa dang / chos kyi dbang phyug la shin tu brtson pa'i bsam pa dang /
analyzed: nas sangs rgyas kyi chos la mnyam pa'i sems su byas te dge ba'i chos nyid la rnam par dpyod cing thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyal srid la rab tu gzhol bar sems bskyed pa dang / chos kyi dbang phyug la shin tu brtson pa'i bsam pa dang /
translated: They are the development of the mind that is impartial toward the qualities of the Buddha, the analysis of the nature of virtuous qualities, the development of the mind that is dedicated to the sovereignty of omniscience, the aspiration that is intent on the mastery of the Dharma,

original: ye shes la dbang sgyur ba thob pa'i yid kyi dbang po dang / yon tan thams cad rnam par spyod pa'i rab tu 'jug pa dang / blo brtan pa dang ldan pa'i bsam pa yangs pa dang / tshogs su gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dang /
analyzed: ye shes la dbang sgyur ba thob pa'i yid kyi dbang po dang / yon tan thams cad rnam par spyod pa'i rab tu 'jug pa dang / blo brtan pa dang ldan pa'i bsam pa yangs pa dang / tshogs su gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dang /
translated: the faculty of the mind that has attained the mastery of wisdom, the engagement in the conduct of all qualities, the vast aspiration that is endowed with a firm intellect, and all the roots of virtue that are gathered together.

original: brtsam par skabs phye ba dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi smon lam dang / gzhan la rag las pa med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos dang / shin tu brtan pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i stobs dang / brtsams pa thams cad mthar 'byin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod pa'i smon lam gyis mi dang yul du bcas pa dang /

translated: They dedicate their roots of virtue to all sentient beings, including their countries and cities, their ornaments, and their retinues, which they give away to beggars.

original: grong khyer dang rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa thams cad gtong bar yongs su btang bas slong ba rnams la yongs su gtong ba'i tshe yul dang mir bcas pa dang / grong khyer dang rgyal po'i pho brang yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: grong khyer dang rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa thams cad gtong bar yongs su btang bas slong ba rnams la yongs su gtong ba'i tshe yul dang mir bcas pa dang / grong khyer dang rgyal po'i pho brang yongs su btang bas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems can thams cad la 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: They dedicate their roots of virtue, which include their countries and cities, their ornaments, and their retinues, which they give away to beggars.

original: yul dang mir bcas pa dang / grong khyer dang rgyal po'i gnas rab @302a *//
analyzed: yul dang mir bcas pa dang / grong khyer dang rgyal po'i gnas rab @302a *//
translated: with their lands, people,🔽cities, and royal palaces,🔽

original: tu byin pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad kyis 'jig rten gyi khams cad rnam par sbyangs te sangs rgyas thams cad bzhugs shing spyod pa'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad la 'bul bar gyur cig /
analyzed: tu byin pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad kyis 'jig rten gyi khams cad rnam par sbyangs te sangs rgyas thams cad bzhugs shing spyod pa'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad la 'bul bar gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings, through the roots of virtue created by my offering of villages, towns, cities, and royal palaces, offer to all the buddhas all the worlds in order to purify them, so that all the buddhas may dwell and act in them.

original: sems can thams cad zhi ba'i gnas rab tu thob cing dgon pa shin tu dben pa la mngon par mos par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad zhi ba'i gnas rab tu thob cing dgon pa shin tu dben pa la mngon par mos par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings attain the state of peace and be devoted to the solitude of the forest.

original: sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i dben pa'i mthar thug par grong dang / grong khyer dang / ljongs dang / khams dang / rgyal po'i gnas la gnas pa med par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i dben pa'i mthar thug par grong dang / grong khyer dang / ljongs dang / khams dang / rgyal po'i gnas la gnas pa med par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings be free from dwelling in villages, towns, countries, regions, and royal palaces, and may they reach the ultimate solitude of unsurpassed peace.

original: sems can thams cad 'jig rten gyi smra ba thams cad las rnam par 'das te 'du 'dzi med par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'jig rten gyi smra ba thams cad las rnam par 'das te 'du 'dzi med par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings be free from all worldly chatter and be free from busyness.

original: sems can thams cad 'gyod pa med pa'i sbyin bdag tu gyur te gtong ba'i sems dang mi 'bral bar gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'gyod pa med pa'i sbyin bdag tu gyur te gtong ba'i sems dang mi 'bral bar gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings become givers who have no regrets, and may they never be separated from the thought of giving.

original: sems can thams cad gnas med pa'i bsam pa rab tu thob cing khyim gyi gnas dang rab tu bral bar gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad gnas med pa'i bsam pa rab tu thob cing khyim gyi gnas dang rab tu bral bar gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings attain the thought of having no home and be free from the home life.

original: sems can thams cad gtong ba shin tu gtong ba'i sems dang ldan zhing gtang bar bya ba gtong bar gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad gtong ba shin tu gtong ba'i sems dang ldan zhing gtang bar bya ba gtong bar gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings have the thought of giving away all that is to be given.

original: sems can thams cad khyim gyi gnas la chags pa las rnam par 'das te gnas pa chud za ba med par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad khyim gyi gnas la chags pa las rnam par 'das te gnas pa chud za ba med par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings transcend attachment to the home life and not waste their lives.

original: sems can thams cad gnod pa dang / 'tshe ba dang / 'jigs pa thams cad las rnam bar 'das te gtse ba thams cad kyis @302b yongs su gtong bar gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad gnod pa dang / 'tshe ba dang / 'jigs pa thams cad las rnam bar 'das te gtse ba thams cad kyis @302b yongs su gtong bar gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings transcend all harm, violence, and fear, and may they be free from all afflictions.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'bul bas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rnam par spyod par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'bul bas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rnam par spyod par gyur cig /
translated: May all sentient beings enjoy all the world systems of all the buddha-fields, by offering them to all the Buddhas.

original: ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chen po yul dang mir bcas pa dang / grong khyer dang rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi gnas yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chen po yul dang mir bcas pa dang / grong khyer dang rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor yongs su gtong ba'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi gnas yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: In this way, when the bodhisattva mahāsattva gives away his country, his people, his city, and his royal palace, he dedicates all those roots of virtue to all sentient beings so that they may purify the place of the buddhafield.

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po g-yog dang 'khor la dga' ba'i mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing ltos pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po g-yog dang 'khor la dga' ba'i mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing ltos pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: “Moreover, the bodhisattva mahāsattva does not hold the signs of delight in servants and retinues to be important, and he has a mind that is independent.

original: 'khor ba thams cad la zhen pa med pa'i rgyud can /
analyzed: 'khor ba thams cad la zhen pa med pa'i rgyud can /
translated: He has a mind that is free from attachment to the whole of saṃsāra.

original: 'dod pa'i dga' ba thams cad kyis sems bcings pa med pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dga' ba thams cad kyis sems bcings pa med pa /
translated: His mind is not bound by any of the pleasures of desire.

original: gzugs kyi rnam pa thams cad la mngon par ma chags pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnam pa thams cad la mngon par ma chags pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: He has a mind that is not attached to any of the aspects of form.

original: 'dod pa'i dga' ba thams cad la sems mi brkam pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dga' ba thams cad la sems mi brkam pa /
translated: His mind is not greedy for any of the pleasures of desire.

original: 'dod pa'i dga' ba sna tshogs su yongs su spyod pa la rtog pa med par gnas pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dga' ba sna tshogs su yongs su spyod pa la rtog pa med par gnas pa /
translated: He was free from concepts, yet he enjoyed all the various pleasures of desire.

original: 'dod pa'i sbyor ba thams cad la chags pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sbyor ba thams cad la chags pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: He had a mind that was free from attachment to all the practices of desire.

original: bud med kyi dga' ba dang / rtsed mo'i dga' ba yongs su spyod pa /
analyzed: bud med kyi dga' ba dang / rtsed mo'i dga' ba yongs su spyod pa /
translated: He enjoyed the pleasures of women and the pleasures of play.

original: thams cad la mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa /
analyzed: thams cad la mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa /
translated: He did not grasp at any characteristics.

original: bud med rin po che'i yan lag dang nying lag thams cad la ma chags pa /
analyzed: bud med rin po che'i yan lag dang nying lag thams cad la ma chags pa /
translated: He was not attached to any of the limbs and minor limbs of the precious women.

original: 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad las phyir mi ldog @303a *//🔽pas g-yog 'khor dang / chung ma'i 'khor dang rol mor bcas pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad las phyir mi ldog @303a *// pas g-yog 'khor dang / chung ma'i 'khor dang rol mor bcas pa /
translated: He was not turned back by any worldly perfection.

analyzed: glu dang / gar dang / rnga dang / rol mo dkrol bar byed cing spyod pa /

analyzed: bsnyen bkur zhing rim gro bya ba la shin tu mkhas par gyur pa /
translated: He was skilled in the practice of service and respect.

original: gzo dang sgyu rtsal shin tu bslab pa /
analyzed: gzo dang sgyu rtsal shin tu bslab pa /

original: 'jig rten pa'i yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa /
translated: He possessed all worldly good qualities.

analyzed: dga' bar byed pa yid du 'ong ba'i rim gros rtse bar byed pa /

analyzed: bud med cang shes kyi tshogs kyis kun nas bskor ba bzhin sdug gu dang / cha byad sdug gu'i bu mo rin po che dang ldan pa /

analyzed: phreng ba dang / spos dang / rgyan gyis rim gror byed pa /

analyzed: bzhad gad dang / rol mos dga' bar rtse zhing bkur sti rnam pa sna tshogs yid du 'ong ba ston pa'i bud med rin po che 'grogs 'grogs pa dag nyan cing mthun par 'dzin pa /
